Quote: Tipani flower skies blazing rapture of color laced tree crowns silhouettes along the ocean diamond necklaced beach...of my heart in fragrance of love spilled by caressing kisses of the sun opening the gates to dive deep through away to horizons with no return...
Author: Oksana Rus

Quote: The spirituality of your soul will lead to your survival in life.
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

Quote: Hope is strength of soul.
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

Quote: The strength of being is divinity within the soul.
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

Quote: You are a beautiful and wonderful soul. Recognise and illuminate it.
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

Quote: Prayer is spirituality of the soul.
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

Quote: Dancing every day uplifts the soul.
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

Quote: Have faith, let go, and gravitate towards.
Author: Stefan Emunds

Quote: If you truly love someone, he or she will inevitably love you back. If you find yourself in an emotional one way street, walk away! Trust that it’s not love.
Author: Stefan Emunds

Quote: A vibrant body, a radiant mind, a loving heart, and an honorable life.
Author: Stefan Emunds

Quote: Mankind's glorious and people's happy ending is inevitable. No one will be left behind.
Author: Stefan Emunds

Quote: Music empowers the soul with great strength.
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

Quote: It is a curious thing, Harry, but perhaps those who are best suited to power are those who have never sought it. Those who, like you, have leadership thrust upon them, and take up the mantle because they must, and find to their own surprise that they wear it well.
Author: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

Quote: To handle yourself, use your head; to handle others, use your heart.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: The mediocre teacher tells. The good teacher explains. The superior teacher demonstrates. The great teacher inspires.
Author: William Arthur Ward

Quote: Our chief want is someone who will inspire us to be what we know we could be.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Don't follow the crowd, let the crowd follow you.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: The greatest leader is not necessarily the one who does the greatest things. He is the one that gets the people to do the greatest things.
Author: Ronald Reagan

Quote: Leadership is not about titles, positions or flowcharts. It is about one life influencing another.
Author: John C. Maxwell

Quote: You have to be burning with an idea, or a problem, or a wrong that you want to right. If you're not passionate enough from the start, you'll never stick it out.
Author: Steve Jobs

Quote: If your actions create a legacy that inspires others to dream more, learn more, do more and become more, then, you are an excellent leader.
Author: Dolly Parton

Quote: Don’t waste your energy trying to educate or change opinions; go over, under, through, and opinions will change organically when you’re the boss. Or they won’t. Who cares? Do your thing, and don’t care if they like it.
Author: Tina Fey, Bossypants

Quote: Power isn’t control at all — power is strength, and giving that strength to others. A leader isn’t someone who forces others to make him stronger; a leader is someone willing to give his strength to others that they may have the strength to stand on their own.
Author: Beth Revis, Across the Universe

Quote: Only one man in a thousand is a leader of men -- the other 999 follow women.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quote: I have three precious things which I hold fast and prize. The first is gentleness; the second is frugality; the third is humility, which keeps me from putting myself before others. Be gentle and you can be bold; be frugal and you can be liberal; avoid putting yourself before others and you can become a leader among men.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: Don't tell people how to do things, tell them what to do and let them surprise you with their results.
Author: George S. Patton Jr.

Quote: You are good. But it is not enough just to be good. You must be good for something. You must contribute good to the world. The world must be a better place for your presence. And the good that is in you must be spread to others....
Author: Gordon B. Hinckley

Quote: A man can only lead when others accept him as their leader, and he has only as much authority as his subjects give to him. All of the brilliant ideas in the world cannot save your kingdom if no one will listen to them.
Author: Brandon Sanderson, The Well of Ascension

Quote: Victory has a hundred fathers and defeat is an o
Author: John F. Kennedy

Quote: He who cannot be a good follower cannot be a good leader.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Leadership and learning are indispensable to each
Author: John F. Kennedy

Quote: ...A man can only stumble for so long before he either falls or stands up straight.
Author: Brandon Sanderson, The Well of Ascension

Quote: Lead me, follow me, or get the hell out of my way.
Author: George S. Patton Jr., Patton Principles

Quote: Example is not the main thing in influencing others. It is the only thing.
Author: Albert Schweitzer

Quote: The mark of a great man is one who knows when to set aside the important things in order to accomplish the vital ones.
Author: Brandon Sanderson, The Alloy of Law

Quote: If you would convince a man that he does wrong, do right. But do not care to convince him. Men will believe what they see. Let them see.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Leadership is the art of getting someone else to do something you want done because he wants to do it.
Author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

Quote: A bit of adviceGiven to a young Native AmericanAt the time of his initiation:As you go the way of life,You will see a great chasm. Jump.It is not as wide as you think.
Author: Joseph Campbell

Quote: If you're not confused, you're not paying attention.
Author: Tom Peters, Thriving on Chaos: Handbook for a Management Revolution

Quote: Be with a leader when he is right, stay with him when he is still right, but, leave him when he is wrong.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: The day the soldiers stop bringing you their problems is the day you stopped leading them. They have either lost confidence that you can help them or concluded that you do not care. Either case is a failure of leadership.
Author: Colin Powell

Quote: You do not lead by hitting people over the head -- that's assault, not leadership.
Author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

Quote: The key to successful leadership is influence, not authority.
Author: Kenneth H. Blanchard

Quote: Efficiency is doing the thing right. Effectiveness is doing the right thing.
Author: Peter F. Drucker

Quote: A leader. . .is like a shepherd. He stays behind the flock, letting the most nimble go out ahead, whereupon the others follow, not realizing that all along they are being directed from behind.
Author: Nelson Mandela, Long Walk to Freedom

Quote: Do you know that one of the great problems of our age is that we are governed by people who care more about feelings than they do about thoughts and ideas.
Author: Margaret Thatcher, Margaret Thatcher

Quote: Not all readers are leaders, but all leaders are readers.
Author: Harry Truman

Quote: Being responsible sometimes means pissing people off.
Author: Colin Powell, On Leadership

Quote: A leader is a dealer in hope.
Author: Napoléon Bonaparte

Quote: The best executive is the one who has sense enough to pick good men to do what he wants done, and self-restraint to keep from meddling with them while they do it.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: Some are young people who don't know who they are, what they can be or even want to be. They are afraid, but they don't know of what. They are angry, but they don't know at whom. They are rejected and they don't know why. All they want is to be somebody.
Author: Thomas S. Monson, Pathways To Perfection: Discourses Of Thomas S. Monson

Quote: A leader takes people where they want to go. A great leader takes people where they don't necessarily want to go, but ought to be.
Author: Rosalynn Carter

Quote: In the end, it is important to remember that we cannot become what we need to be, by remaining what we are.
Author: Max DePree, Leadership Is an Art

Quote: I would like to be known as a person who is concerned about freedom and equality and justice and prosperity for all people.
Author: Rosa Parks

Quote: If soldiers are punished before they have grown attached to you, they will not prove submissive;and, unless submissive, then will be practically useless. If, when the soldiers have become attachedto you, punishments are not enforced, they will still be unless.
Author: Sun Tzu, The Art of War

Quote: The secret of leadership is simple: Do what you believe in. Paint a picture of the future. Go there.People will follow.
Author: Seth Godin, Tribes: We Need You to Lead Us

Quote: And therefore I am come amongst you at this time, not as for my recreation or sport, but being resolved, in the midst and heat of the battle, to live or die amongst you all; to lay down, for my God, and for my kingdom, and for my people, my honour and my blood, even the dust. I know I have but the body of a weak and feeble woman; but I have the heart of a king, and of a king of England, too.
Author: Elizabeth I

Quote: You did what your heart told you to do,' Brain complimented. 'It is what leaders, not followers, do.
Author: Tonya Hurley, Homecoming

Quote: And if the blind lead the blind, both shall fall into the ditch.
Author: Anonymous, Holy Bible: New International Version

Quote: ...There are also those who inadvertently grant power to another man's words by continuously trying to spite him. If a man gets to the point where he can simply say, 'The sky is blue,' and people indignantly rush up trying to refute him saying, 'No, the sky is light blue,' then, whether they realize it or not, he has become an authority figure even to such adversaries.
Author: Criss Jami, Killosophy

Quote: A general never shows despair. He instills confidence in his troops. He leads them forward, even into the mouth of death.
Author: Rick Riordan, The Throne of Fire

Quote: You don't know what you can get away with until you try.
Author: Colin Powell

Quote: There is a darkness in you. In all of us, probably. Beasts we keep chained. Ordinary men have to keep the chains strong, for if we let the beast loose then society will turn upon us with fiery vengeance. Kings though...well, who is there to turn upon them? So the chains are made of straw. It is the curse of kings, Helikaon, that they can become monsters. And they invariably do.
Author: David Gemmell, Shield of Thunder

Quote: If you can't swallow your pride, you can't lead. Even the highest mountain had animals that step on it.
Author: Jack Weatherford, Genghis Khan and the Making of the Modern World

Quote: Leaders always choose the harder right rather than the easier wrong.
Author: Orrin Woodward

Quote: The leaders who work most effectively, it seems to me, never say "I." And that's not because they have trained themselves not to say "I." They don't think "I." They think "we"; they think "team." They understand their job to be to make the team function. They accept responsibility and don't sidestep it, but "we" gets the credit. This is what creates trust, what enables you to get the task done.
Author: Peter F. Drucker

Quote: Give as few orders as possible," his father had told him once long ago. "Once you've given orders on a subject, you must always give orders on that subject.
Author: Frank Herbert, Dune

Quote: The best form of saying is being
Author: Ernesto Che Guevara, Passages de la guerre révolutionnaire : le Congo

Quote: Always remember, Son, the best boss is the one who bosses the least. Whether it's cattle, or horses, or men; the least government is the best government.
Author: Ralph Moody

Quote: Real leadership is being the person others will gladly and confidently follow.
Author: John C. Maxwell

Quote: He that thinketh he leadeth and hath no one following him is only taking a walk.
Author: John C. Maxwell

Quote: In a battle between  two ideas, the best one doesn't necessarily win. No, the idea that wins is the one with the most fearless heretic behind it.
Author: Seth Godin, Tribes: We Need You to Lead Us

Quote: Any man who retreats into a cave which has only one opening deserves to die.
Author: Frank Herbert, Dune

Quote: The first key to leadership is self-control.
Author: Jack Weatherford, Genghis Khan and the Making of the Modern World

Quote: A sign of power in a man is not only when people follow what he suggests, but also when people make a conscious effort to do the exact opposite of what he suggests.
Author: Criss Jami, Killosophy

Quote: I'll be long gone before some smart person ever figures out what happened inside this Oval Office."(Washington DC, 12 May, 2008)
Author: George W. Bush

Quote: Why did Africa let Europe cart away millions of Africa's souls from the continent to the four corners of the wind? How could Europe lord it over a continent ten times its size? Why does needy Africa continue to let its wealth meet the needs of those outside its borders and then follow behind with hands outstretched for a loan of the very wealth it let go? How did we arrive at this, that the best leader is the one that knows how to beg for a share of what he has already given away at the price of a broken tool? Where is the future of Africa?
Author: Ngũgĩ wa Thiong’o, Wizard of the Crow

Quote: The art of leadership is saying no, not yes. It is very easy to say yes.
Author: Tony Blair

Quote: A star wants to see himself rise to the top.A leader wants to see those around him rise to the top.
Author: Simon Sinek

Quote: (On being in a position of leadership) Even if it's your dog, you've got authority over somebody. Start treating him better.
Author: Joyce Meyer

Quote: Always try to associate yourself with and learn as much as you can from those who know more than you do, who do better than you, who see more clearly than you.
Author: Dwight D. Eisenhower, At Ease: Stories I Tell to Friends

Quote: Together we are better
Author: John Paul Warren

Quote: Remember teamwork begins by building trust. And the only way to do that is to overcome our need for invulnerability.
Author: Patrick Lencioni, The Five Dysfunctions of a Team: A Leadership Fable

Quote: The world is full of men who want to be right, when actually the secret of a man's strength and his pathway to true honor is his ability to admit fault when he has failed. God wants to fill the church with men who can say they are wrong when THEY ARE WRONG. A man who is willing to humble himself before God and his family and say:"I was wrong." will find that his family has all the confidence in the world in him and will much more readily follow him. If he stubbornly refuses to repent or admit he was wrong, their confidence in him and in his leadership erodes.
Author: Jim Anderson, Unmasked: Exposing the Cultural Sexual Assault

Quote: True leaders understand that leadership is not about them but about those they serve. It is not about exalting themselves but about lifting others up.
Author: Sheri Dew, Saying It Like It Is

Quote: The task of the leader is to get his people from where they are to where they have not been.
Author: Henry Kissinger

Quote: Each day you are leading by example. Whether you realize it or not or whether it's positive or negative, you are influencing those around you.
Author: Rob Liano

Quote: At that moment, in the sunset on Watership Down, there was offered to General Woundwort the opportunity to show whether he was really the leader of vision and genius which he believed himself to be, or whether he was no more than a tyrant with the courage and cunning of a pirate. For one beat of his pulse the lame rabbit's idea shone clearly before him. He grasped it and realized what it meant. The next, he had pushed it away from him.
Author: Richard Adams, Watership Down

Quote: I must follow the people. Am I not their leader?
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: To all those watching tonight from beyond our shores, from parliaments and palaces, to those who are huddled around radios in the forgotten corners of the world, our stories are singular, but our destiny is shared, and a new dawn of American leadership is at hand.
Author: Barack Obama

Quote: A leader must lead. Where others see obstacles, he must see opportunities. When others see problems, he must see possibilities ... Civilization is not built on a negation but on an affirmation- an affirmation of the bright and promising possibilities that the future holds for those who are enterprising enough to pursue them.
Author: David J. Vaughan, Give Me Liberty: The Uncompromising Statesmanship of Patrick Henry

Quote: Show me the man you honor and I will know what kind of man you are.
Author: Thomas John Carlisle

Quote: The key to every man is his thought. Sturdy and defying though he look, he has a helm which he obeys, which is the idea after which all his facts are classified. He can only be reformed by showing him a new idea which commands his own.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Leaders in all realms and activities of life knew that the power they had come to hold existed because they were responsible to serve the many, thus power was position of service.
Author: Vanna Bonta, Flight: A Quantum Fiction Novel

Quote: Go to the people. Live with them. Learn from them. Love them. Startwith what they know. Build with what they have. But with the bestleaders, when the work is done, the task accomplished, the people willsay 'We have done this ourselves.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: Rank does not confer privilege or give power. It imposes responsibility.
Author: Peter F. Drucker

Quote: Great teams do not hold back with one another. They are unafraid to air their dirty laundry. They admit their mistakes, their weaknesses, and their concerns without fear of reprisal.
Author: Patrick Lencioni, The Five Dysfunctions of a Team: A Leadership Fable

Quote: Unless today is well lived, tomorrow is not important.
Author: Alan Sakowitz, Miles Away... Worlds Apart

Quote: People in any organization are always attached to the obsolete - the things that should have worked but did not, the things that once were productive and no longer are.
Author: Peter F. Drucker

Quote: Man wants to be the king o’ the rabbits, he best wear a pair o’ floppy ears.
Author: George R.R. Martin, A Dance with Dragons

Quote: In the end,” Callum said, his voice soft, gentle, “it all comes back to you. You protect them [your pack], you love them, you live for them, and someday, you die. That’s what it means, Bryn-girl, to be what we are [to be Alpha]. It’s lonely. It’s impossible. It’s all-consuming.” It is what it is.
Author: Jennifer Lynn Barnes, Trial by Fire

Quote: A vision we give to others of who and what they could become has power when it echoes what the spirit has already spoken into their souls.
Author: Larry Crabb

Quote: There's got to be more to life than just living," Foyle said to the robot."Then find it for yourself, sir. Don't ask the world to stop moving because you have doubts.""Why can't we all move forward together?""Because you're all different. You're not lemmings. Some must lead, and hope that the rest will follow.""Who leads?""The men who must...driven men, compelled men.""Freak men.""You're all freaks, sir. But you always have been freaks. Life is a freak. That's its hope and glory.""Thank you very much.""My pleasure, sir.""You've saved the day.""Always a lovely day somewhere, sir," the robot beamed. Then it fizzed, jangled, and collapsed.
Author: Alfred Bester, The Stars My Destination

Quote: The bottom line in managing your emotions is that you should put others – not yourself – first in how you handle and process them. Whether you delay or display your emotions should not be for your own gratification. You should ask yourself, What does the team need? Not, What will make me feel better?
Author: John C. Maxwell, The 360 Degree Leader: Developing Your Influence from Anywhere in the Organization

Quote: If you spend your life trying to be good at everything, you will never be great at anything.
Author: Tom Rath, Strengths Based Leadership: Great Leaders, Teams, and Why People Follow: A Landmark Study of Great Leaders, Teams, and the Reasons Why We Follow

Quote: Stop counting your "years" and start enjoying your "seasons".
Author: John Paul Warren

Quote: It’s not just picking the right friends. It is being the right friend.
Author: John Paul Warren

Quote: Belief has the power to change your inner state and your outer world.
Author: John Paul Warren

Quote: The ruler attains wholeness in the correct governance of the people.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: If you perceive right you receive right. If you perceive wrong you receive wrong.
Author: John Paul Warren

Quote: Although individuals need not be well-rounded, teams should be.
Author: Tom Rath, Strengths Based Leadership: Great Leaders, Teams, and Why People Follow: A Landmark Study of Great Leaders, Teams, and the Reasons Why We Follow

Quote: The world is full of stupid people. That's why we have rules. But with enough intelligence, a person can be above the rules. She can make rules.
Author: Daniel Nayeri, Another Faust

Quote: Neoteny is more than retaining a youthful appearance, although that is often part of it. Neoteny is the retention of all those wonderful qualities that we associate with youth: curiosity, playfulness, eagerness, fearlessness, warmth, energy. Unlike those defeated by time and age, our geezers have remained much like our geeks – open, willing to take risks, hungry for knowledge and experience, courageous, eager to see what the new day brings. Time and lost steal the zest from the unlucky, and leave them looking longingly at the past. Neoteny is a metaphor for the quality – and the gift – that keeps the fortunate of whatever age focused on all marvelous undiscovered things to come.
Author: Warren G. Bennis, Geeks and Geezers: How Era, Values and Defining Moments Shape Leaders

Quote: To win the big stakes in this changed world, you must catch the spirit of the great pioneers of the past, whose dreams have given to civilization all that it has of value, the spirit that serves as the life-blood of our own country – your opportunity and mine, to develop and market our talents.
Author: Napoleon Hill, Think and Grow Rich: The Landmark Bestseller - Now Revised and Updated for the 21st Century

Quote: Your first and foremost job as a leader is to take charge of your own energy and then help to orchestrate the energy of those around you.
Author: Peter F. Drucker

Quote: Remember that mentor leadership is all about serving. Jesus said, “For even the Son of Man came not to be served but to serve others and to give his life as a ransom for many” (Mark 10:45).
Author: Tony Dungy, The Mentor Leader: Secrets to Building People and Teams That Win Consistently

Quote: I conceive a knowledge of books is the basis upon which other knowledge is to be built.
Author: George Washington

Quote: I am more afraid of an army of 100 sheep led by a lion than an army of 100 lions led by a sheep
Author: Charles Maurice de Talleyrand-Périgord

Quote: I would not be a Moses to lead you into the Promised Land, because if I could lead you into it, someone else could lead you out of it.
Author: Eugene V. Debs

Quote: Sheep are always looking for a new shepherd when the terrain gets rocky.
Author: Karen Marie Moning, Iced

Quote: Your life is a trajectory. Every choice you make alters that trajectory, in a positive or negative way. Will you categorize that dinner with friends as a business expense? Will you be honest with your daughter? Will you take more credit than you’re due? These are just the small questions that we face every day, and little by little, the answers influence the trajectory of our lives and beings.
Author: Donald Van de Mark

Quote: No great manager or leader ever fell from heaven, its learned not inherited.
Author: Tom Northup

Quote: Tend to the people, and they will tend to the business.
Author: John C. Maxwell, The 360 Degree Leader: Developing Your Influence from Anywhere in the Organization

Quote: Real men don't dance to other people's tune, instead, they play for others to dance.
Author: Michael Bassey Johnson

Quote: I define my life not by the things I have done, but by the people I have loved.
Author: John Paul Warren

Quote: It is the capacity to develop and improve their skills that distinguishes leaders from followers.
Author: Warren G. Bennis

Quote: One person with commitment accomplishes more than a thousand with an opinion.
Author: Orrin Woodward, LIFE

Quote: the quality of your mind depends on the quality of your thought
Author: okorie deborah

Quote: Most people don't care who's in charge as long as someone is.
Author: Tanya Huff, Nights of the Round Table and Other Stories of Heroic Fantasy

Quote: Tis skill, not strength, that governs a ship
Author: Thomas Fuller

Quote: As more and more artificial intelligence is entering into the world, more and more emotional intelligence must enter into leadership.
Author: Amit Ray, Mindfulness Meditation for Corporate Leadership and Management

Quote: Leadership grows like tall trees. It needs both toughness and flexibility - toughness for accountability - flexibility to adapt changes with a compassionate & caring heart for self and others.
Author: Amit Ray, Mindfulness Meditation for Corporate Leadership and Management

Quote: You can’t move up in the staircase of leadership unless you are emotionally intelligent.
Author: Amit Ray, Mindfulness Meditation for Corporate Leadership and Management

Quote: Whenever you see a successful business, someone once made a courageous decision.
Author: Peter F. Drucker

Quote: Real leaders are people who “help us overcome the limitations of our own individual laziness and selfishness and weakness and fear and get us to do better, harder things than we can get ourselves to do on our own.
Author: David Foster Wallace

Quote: When you accept a leadership role, you take on extra responsibility for your actions toward others.
Author: Kelley Armstrong, The Calling

Quote: When you put together deep knowledge about a subject that intensely matters to you, charisma happens. You gain courage to share your passion, and when you do that, folks follow.
Author: Jerry Porras, Success Built to Last: Creating a Life that Matters

Quote: When eagles are silent, parrots begin to chatter.
Author: Winston S. Churchill

Quote: It is absolutely necessary... for me to have persons that can think for me, as well as execute orders.
Author: George Washington

Quote: Delegating work works, provided the one delegating works, too.
Author: Robert Half

Quote: Be a FRIEND and stop worrying about having any
Author: John Paul Warren

Quote: The very essence of leadership is that you have to have vision. You can't blow an uncertain trumpet.
Author: Theodore M. Hesburgh

Quote: Impossible situations TEST you and PROVE Him
Author: John Paul Warren

Quote: Great leaders get people to admit the truth because they know that dreams are buried under the lies they tell themselves, in order to feel okay with giving up.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: ...You have any suggestions, make them. I'm in charge but humble. No need to salute when you see me." Fraser said, "Mind if we snicker every once in a while behind your back?" "Hell, no," I said. "Everyone else does.
Author: Robert B. Parker, The Widening Gyre

Quote: Alas! in the clothes of the greatest potentate, what is there but a man?
Author: Robert Louis Stevenson, The Suicide Club

Quote: He said, one time, that no true leader burdened his followers with a greater load than they could carry, and no true leader sets too fast a pace for his follows to keep up.
Author: Malcolm X, The Autobiography of Malcolm X

Quote: Good leaders have vision and inspire others to help them turn vision into reality. Great leaders have vision, share vision, and inspire others to create their own.
Author: Roy  Bennett

Quote: You are either supporting the vision or supporting division
Author: Saji Ijiyemi

Quote: Compassionate leaders honor the complexity of human relationships, nurture authenticity and create common grounds for blooming great ideas of individuals.
Author: Amit Ray, Mindfulness Meditation for Corporate Leadership and Management

Quote: In essence, leadership is the sense of calling to a higher purpose.
Author: Amit Ray, Mindfulness Meditation for Corporate Leadership and Management

Quote: Compassionate leaders know their stakeholders and address their concerns, their hopes, dreams and fears.
Author: Amit Ray, Mindfulness Meditation for Corporate Leadership and Management

Quote: You are not alone in the struggles of life. Entire cosmos is with you. It evolves through the way you face and overcome challenges of life. Use everything in your advantage.
Author: Amit Ray, Mindfulness Meditation for Corporate Leadership and Management

Quote: Too many companies believe people are interchangeable. Truly gifted people never are. They have unique talents. Such people cannot be forced into roles they are not suited for, nor should they be. Effective leaders allow great people to do the work they were born to do.
Author: Warren G. Bennis, Organizing Genius: The Secrets of Creative Collaboration

Quote: All organizations are perfectly designed to get the results they are now getting. If we want different results, we must change the way we do things.
Author: Tom Northup

Quote: The growth and development of people is the highest calling of leadership.
Author: Harvey S. Firestone

Quote: We should always aim to read something different=not only the writers with whom we agree, but those with whom we are ready to do battle. Their point of view challenges us to examine the truth and to test their views...and let us not comment on nor criticize writers of whom we have heard only second-hand, or third-hand without troubling to read their works for ourselves...Don't be afraid of new ideas.
Author: J. Oswald Sanders, Spiritual Leadership

Quote: The person who sees the difficulties so clearly that he does not discern the possibilities cannot inspire a vision in others.
Author: J. Oswald Sanders, Spiritual Leadership

Quote: Accountants are in the past, managers are in the present, and leaders are in the future.
Author: Paul Orfalea, Copy This!: Lessons from a Hyperactive Dyslexic who Turned a Bright Idea Into One of America's Best Companies

Quote: Some great men owe most of their greatness to the ability of detecting in those they destine for their tools the exact quality of strength that matters for their work.
Author: Joseph Conrad

Quote: The slaves in Rome were incapable of leisure and so their masters gave them entertainment to keep them pacified.
Author: Oliver DeMille

Quote: Leadership isn't about power for the sake of power - not true leadership. Instead it deals with modeling behavior you want others to have, and with responsibility for being certain the people you lead are treated equitably, and with respect. Not an easy task. You can't make other people feel anything, or think anything; you can only try to teach them what you want them to feel and think and why you think they should act accordingly.
Author: Laura Weakley

Quote: And a leader has to command confidence, and consent.
Author: John Christopher, When the Tripods Came

Quote: I'm accustomed to being top man. I been a bull goose catskinner for every gyppo logging operation in the Northwest and bull goose gambler all the way from Korea, was even bull goose pea weeder on that pea farm at Pendleton -- so I figure if I'm bound to be a loony, then I'm bound to be a stompdown dadgum good one.
Author: Ken Kesey, One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

Quote: Your outlook affects your outcome
Author: John Paul Warren

Quote: (Patrick Henry) He understood that the home was the foundation of a stable society and that the authority a man "exercised within the larger society was rooted in the authority exercised at home." Thus ... the training ground for all sound leadership is the family.
Author: David J. Vaughan, Give Me Liberty: The Uncompromising Statesmanship of Patrick Henry

Quote: My life has far exceeded my expectations not because of my own personal efforts or mindset but because of my friends who have enriched my existence
Author: John Paul Warren

Quote: A leader takes people where they would never go on their own.
Author: Hans Finzel, The Top Ten Mistakes Leaders Make

Quote: Leading people is like cookingDon’t stir too much It annoys the ingredients And spoils the food
Author: Rick Julian

Quote: Leadership is a two-way street, loyalty up and loyalty
Author: Grace Murray Hopper

Quote: Good business leaders create a vision, articulate the vision, passionately own the vision, and relentlessly drive it to completion.
Author: Jack Welch

Quote: Stories are the single most powerful weapon in a leader’s arsenal
Author: Howard Gardner

Quote: Blessed are the people whose leaders can look destiny in the eye without flinching but also without attempting to play God
Author: Henry Kissinger

Quote: So if you see no one like you, no one who agrees, don't worry. There are actually hundreds of people like you, and they're waiting for a leader. That person is you.
Author: Julien Smith, The Flinch

Quote: Regard your soldiers as your children, and they will follow you into the deepest valleys; look upon them as your own beloved sons, and they will stand by you even unto death.
Author: Sun Tzu, The Art of War

Quote: The task of leadership is not to put greatness into humanity, but to elicit it, for the greatness is already there.
Author: John Buchan

Quote: God uses imperfect people for impossible tasks
Author: John Paul Warren

Quote: I have the charisma of the chipmunk. I never have thought I was smart. I thought the people I dealt with were dumb.
Author: Hyman George Rickover

Quote: Leaders draw out ones individual greatness
Author: John Paul Warren

Quote: Too many in the Church today are likes babies in the nursery,they put everything in their mouth.
Author: John Paul Warren

Quote: [Nicodemus] 'Magistra DeVega, can I ask for your help?'[DeVega] 'You can ask,' she said with her usual calmness, 'but the clerics haven't developed a cure for death by idiotic leadership.
Author: Blake Charlton, Spellbound

Quote: A good businessman must have nose for business the same way a journalist has nose for news. In places where people see a lot of obstacles, I see a lot of opportunities. A good businessman sees where others don’t see.
Author: Orji Uzor Kalu

Quote: live as temporal, serve as eternal
Author: John Paul Warren

Quote: A system is corrupt when it is strictly profit-driven, not driven to serve the best interests of its people, but those of multinational corporations.
Author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem

Quote: Managers maintain an efficient status quo while leaders attack the status quo to create something new.
Author: Orrin Woodward, LIFE

Quote: Leadership is not just some empty formulas but establishing deep connection at soul levels through service, integrity, passion, perseverance and equanimity.
Author: Amit Ray, Mindfulness Meditation for Corporate Leadership and Management

Quote: You are blessed, You are great. You are not alone. You are powerful.
Author: Amit Ray, Mindfulness Meditation for Corporate Leadership and Management

Quote: Great leader knows that under the turmoil of chaos and change, there is a beauty of patterns and designs.
Author: Amit Ray, Mindfulness Meditation for Corporate Leadership and Management

Quote: If you are not extreme, then people will take shortcuts because they don't fear you.
Author: Marco Pierre White, The Devil in the Kitchen: Sex, Pain, Madness and the Making of a Great Chef

Quote: If the leader is filled with high ambition and if he pursues his aims with audacity and strength of will, he will reach them in spite of all obstacles.
Author: Carl von Clausewitz

Quote: True greatness, true leadership, is achieved not by reducing men to one's service but in giving oneself in selfless service to them.
Author: J. Oswald Sanders

Quote: Who succeeds in forming and leading a Great Group? He or she is almost always a pragmatic dreamer. They are people who get things done, but they are people with immortal longings. Often, they are scientifically minded people with poetry in their souls.
Author: Warren G. Bennis, Organizing Genius: The Secrets of Creative Collaboration

Quote: Without the vision of a goal, a man cannot manage his own life, much less the lives of others.
Author: Jack Weatherford, Genghis Khan and the Making of the Modern World

Quote: People want guidance, not rhetoric. They need to know what the plan of action is, and how it will be implemented. They want to be given responsibility to help solve the problem and authority to act on it.
Author: Howard Schultz, Pour Your Heart Into It: How Starbucks Built a Company One Cup at a Time

Quote: The essential difference with Builders is that they've found something to do that matters to them and are therefore so passionately engaged, they rise above the personality baggage that would otherwise hold them down. Whatever they are doing has so much meaning to them that the cause itself provides charisma and they plug into it as if it was electrical current.
Author: Jerry Porras, Success Built to Last: Creating a Life that Matters

Quote: Diplomacy is the delicate weapon of the civilized warrior."- Hun, A. T.
Author: Robert Lynn Asprin, Myth Conceptions

Quote: Great Groups need to know that the person at the top will fight like a tiger for them.
Author: Warren G. Bennis, Organizing Genius: The Secrets of Creative Collaboration

Quote: The president had shifted to the 'we' mode now, something he invariably did when a potentially unpopular decision was at hand. For the easy ones, it was always 'I.' When he needed a crutch, and especially when he would need someone to blame, he opened up the decisionmaking process and included Critz.
Author: John Grisham, The Broker

Quote: If you seek honor and respect you will not find it, for a leader is powerless to elevate himself. It is only when you serve others without regard for self, will honor, respect and lasting success be found.
Author: Stevenson Willis, Thes Proverbs of Leadership

Quote: It is the tendency of deep feeling to subdue the manner rather than to render it too energetic.
Author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon, Lectures to My Students

Quote: Make a difference, change the game for the better, leave a legacy, be a guide that someone else can follow and make better, and then someone else will follow that and make that better.
Author: Carlos Wallace, The Other 99 T.Y.M.E.S: Train Your Mind to Enjoy Serenity

Quote: Great leaders have three things; inner light, inner vision and inner strength.
Author: Amit Ray, Mindfulness Meditation for Corporate Leadership and Management

Quote: [T]hese leaders must not believe they are actually being watched, for their behavior in no way reflects the possible existence of a set of values or ethical laws that supersedes their own dominion.
Author: Arthur C. Clarke, The Garden of Rama

Quote: Government was rarely more than a choice between the disastrous and the unpalatable.
Author: Barbara W. Tuchman, The March of Folly: From Troy to Vietnam

Quote: The first key to leadership was self-control, particularly the mastery of pride, which was something more difficult, he explained, to subdue than a wild lion and anger, which was more difficult to defeat than the greatest wrestler. He warned them that "if you can't swallow your pride, you can't lead.
Author: Jack Weatherford, Genghis Khan and the Making of the Modern World

Quote: The power to lead is the power to mislead, and the power to mislead is the power to destroy.
Author: Thomas S. Monson

Quote: Leadership is the art of giving people a platform for spreading ideas that work.
Author: Seth Godin, Tribes: We Need You to Lead Us

Quote: Leaders..should influence others..in such a way that it builds people up, encourages and edifies them so they can duplicate this attitude in others.
Author: Bob Goshen

Quote: It's not about you. It's about them.
Author: Clint Eastwood

Quote: ‎"You will never reach your dreams without honoring others along the way.
Author: John Paul Warren

Quote: If there were only success in your life, you would not learn anything. Leadership is experience and you are still young. You still have much to learn about our people and war; it should not come easy to you. If it did, you would be robbed of life's most valuable teacher.
Author: Rachel Higginson, Fearless Magic

Quote: In the world at large we seldom vote for a principle or a given state of affairs. We vote for a man who pretends to believe in that principle or promises to achieve that state. We don't want a man, we want a condition of peace and plenty-- or, it may be, war and want-- but we must vote for a man.
Author: B.F. Skinner, Walden Two

Quote: Many have exchanged the touch of God for the applause of men
Author: John Paul Warren

Quote: The present representative of the Dedlocks is an excellent master. He supposes all his dependents to be utterly bereft of individual characters, intentions, or opinions, and is persuaded that he was born to supersede the necessity of their having any. If he were to make a discovery to the contrary, he would be simply stunned — would never recover himself, most likely, except to gasp and die.
Author: Charles Dickens, Bleak House

Quote: Lobbing hand grenades on the bride of Christ takes zero talent or effort. I also think this really ticks God off. My five-year-old child complains and whines when things aren't the way she wants them, but courageous men and women roll up their sleeves and get busy. I want to be an active participant in putting back together the broken pieces.
Author: Mike  Foster

Quote: Leaders are people who believe so passionately that they can seduce other people into sharing their dream.
Author: Warren G. Bennis, Organizing Genius: The Secrets of Creative Collaboration

Quote: The real winners in life are the people who look at every situation with an expectation that they can make it work ot make it better.
Author: Barbra Pletcher

Quote: Leadership is for those who love the public good and are endowed and trained to administer it.
Author: Thornton Wilder, The Ides of March

Quote: In politics, Bugs Bunny always beats Daffy Duck. Daffy's always going berserk, jumping up and down, yelling. Bugs's got that sly smile, like he always knows what's up, like nothing can ruffle him.
Author: Jeff Greenfield, Then Everything Changed: Stunning Alternate Histories of American Politics: JFK, RFK, Carter, Ford, Reagan

Quote: the condition of leadership adds new degrees of solitariness to the basic solitude of mankind. Every order that we issue increases the extent to which we are alone, and every show of deference which is extended to us separates us from our fellows.
Author: Thornton Wilder, The Ides of March

Quote: Successful leaders see the opportunities in every difficulty rather than the difficulty in every opportunity
Author: Reed Markham

Quote: Women feel a need for a certain level of prior training and experience that men do not necessarily demand in order to jump into a new role. There's a need for women to trust themselves more...
Author: Selena Rezvani, The Next Generation of Women Leaders: What You Need to Lead But Won't Learn in Business School

Quote: Count your blessings, discount you’re loses
Author: John Paul Warren

Quote: Through real-life stories, Kristin Kaufman illustrates the core idea of being present in the moment and opening oneself up to new ideas in order to become an authentic leader in life.
Author: Stephen R. Covey

Quote: No.” Allie stood her ground. “I’ll not go in.““Me, neither.” Jason slid from his horse. “If Allie ain’t going in, I’m not going in.”Wes glanced skyward. How was it possible for his near mute wife to pick up an echo? After four years in the Army, leading men, and two years of pushing cattle to market, it took Allie to make Wes realize that a leader wasn’t a leader unless he had a follower.“All right, where would you like to sleep tonight?
Author: Jodi Thomas, To Kiss a Texan

Quote: In a team setting, leadership is shared by a community of people, which counters the tendency for pastors to form congregations in their own images.
Author: Adam S. McHugh, Introverts in the Church: Finding Our Place in an Extroverted Culture

Quote: Leadership is a potent combination of strategy and character. But if you must be without one, be without the strategy.
Author: Norman Schwarzkopf

Quote: They stood there, King of the Hill, Top of the Heap, Ruler of All They Surveyed, Unimpeachable Monarchs and Presidents, trying to understand what it meant to own a world and how big a world really was.
Author: Ray Bradbury, The Martian Chronicles

Quote: Exercising leadership is an expression of your aliveness... But when you cover yourself up, you risk losing something as well. In the struggle to save yourself, you can give up too many of those qualities that are the essence of being alive, like innocence, curiosity, and compassion.
Author: Ronald A. Heifetz, Leadership on the Line: Staying Alive Through the Dangers of Leading

Quote: If done "as God wants.' then leadership will surely include intercessory prayer. The saintly Bishop Azariah of India once remarked to Bishop Stephen Neill that he found time to pray daily, by name, for every leader in his extensive diocese. Little wonder that during his thirty years of eldering there, the diocese tripled its membership and greatly increase in spiritual effectiveness
Author: J. Oswald Sanders

Quote: The mind is a storehouse with great capacity, but is often filled with dubious knowledge and meaningless trivialities. In truth, much of this - though at times interesting and entertaining - is of insignificant value.
Author: Stevenson Willis, Thes Proverbs of Leadership

Quote: The process of gaining power employs means which degrade or brutalize the seeker, who awakes to find that power has been possessed at the cost of virtue or moral purpose lost.
Author: Barbara W. Tuchman, The March of Folly: From Troy to Vietnam

Quote: Sasha: "It's not your fault. You were doing what you thought was best to keep them safe. It isn't easy, making those kinds of decisions. I know that. And I also know the difference between you when you're trying to be the leader and you when you get to just be a boy."Wells: "It's funny you should say that,""Say what?""That you see the difference between me as a leader and me as a person.""I believe I said boy." she corrected.~Chapter 21 Pg: 228
Author: Kass Morgan

Quote: The conservatives had started bringing demagoguery to the table on the [Afghan] war issue the previous fall [fall 2006]. Whenever opposition members criticized the war policy, assorted Tories accused them of being disloyal and of failing to support the troops....[Harper] was gaining the reputation of a leader who couldn't see a belt without wanting to hit below it.
Author: Lawrence Martin, Harperland: The Politics Of Control

Quote: Effective decision-making can be seen as an optimal link between memory of the past, ground-realities of the present and insights of the future.
Author: Amit Ray, Mindfulness Meditation for Corporate Leadership and Management

Quote: Point me in the right direction, and shut the fuck up. I'm the one calling the shots now. Fall in line or fall down a fucking well.
Author: Robert Kirkman, The Walking Dead, Vol. 26: Call to Arms

Quote: The choice to lead is nurtured by the willingness to rise above challenges of life.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Ladder

Quote: Be the start of something that is good, revolutionary and powerful. Everything after that is a bonus!
Author: Carlos Wallace, The Other 99 T.Y.M.E.S: Train Your Mind to Enjoy Serenity

Quote: Never undermine the power of passion. You have a very high chance of achieving anything you are passionate about.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Try not to leave your work for someone else to do. If possible, carry the work of someone and add it to yours. That's a trait of leaders!
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Contrary to popular opinion, leadership is not a reserved position for a particular group of people who were elected or appointed, ordained or enthroned. Leadership is self-made, self-retained, self-inculcated and then exposed through a faithful, sincere and examplary life.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor

Quote: All great leaders find a sense of balance through their levels of reception. For instance, those who support a leader may soften him, those who ignore him may challenge him, and those who oppose him may stroke his ego.
Author: Criss Jami, Killosophy

Quote: A true leader is still a leader even when he takes up servants' duty, provided he maintains a human face and added integrity to his self-retained qualities.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor

Quote: If you want people to to think, give them intent, not instruction.
Author: L. David Marquet

Quote: If you don’t know what you value in life, then you won’t be able to make any meaningful decisions you can live with in the future.
Author: Shannon L. Alder

Quote: Jackson lead as he lived, sometimes with his heart, sometimes with his mind, sometimes with both.
Author: Jon Meacham, American Lion: Andrew Jackson in the White House

Quote: Fear cannot be banished, but it can be calm and without panic; it can be mitigated by reason and evaluation.
Author: Vannevar Bush

Quote: After Peter came to recognize his own inadequacy, his utter inability to fulfill his destiny apart from obedience to his only true responsibility, he became a rock-solid leader. As his story unfolds in the book of acts, we can clearly see that when Peter kept his eyes on Jesus and followed Him, others followed to. And they followed by the thousands. Needed today: more Peters.
Author: Charles R. Swindoll

Quote: Yes, in all my research, the greatest leaders looked inward and were able to tell a good story with authenticity and passion.
Author: Depak Chopras

Quote: Without courage, it doesn't matter how good the leader's intentions are.
Author: Orrin Woodward, LIFE

Quote: Winners see the dream and develop plans while the rest see the obstacles and develop justifications.
Author: Orrin Woodward, LIFE

Quote: Today this courtyard was filled with great warriors. What is more? But it was not filled with great men who have the heart to rule a kingdom. Any man can kill, Finnikin. It is a stroke, an action with one's hand. But not every man knows how to lead.
Author: Melina Marchetta, Finnikin of the Rock

Quote: You accomplish exactly as much as the people who serve you decide you'll accomplish, and nothing more.
Author: Orson Scott Card, Shadow Puppets

Quote: He was not ill-fitted to be the head and representative of a community which owed its origin and progress, and its present state of development, not to the impulses of youth, but to the stern and tempered energies of manhood and the sombre sagacity of age; accomplishing so much, precisely because it imagined and hoped so little.
Author: Nathaniel Hawthorne, The Scarlet Letter

Quote: [Ella Baker]'s second defining characteristic was her dislike of top-down leadership... 'She felt leaders were not appointed but the rose up. Someone will rise. Someone will emerge'. It was an attitude Baker shared with some of the older women in the movement.
Author: Gail Collins, When Everything Changed: The Amazing Journey of American Women from 1960 to the Present

Quote: (Vice President) Garner has taken his personal smallness, his lack of generosity, and forged it into a political principle. He has no imagination, no convictions, and he substitutes political cynicism for social understanding.
Author: Hamilton Basso

Quote: a leadership is a position of action process of abolition,completion of mission,over come oppositionand submission of duties
Author: akhil aravind

Quote: How was your day? If your answer was "fine," then I don't think you were leading.
Author: Seth Godin, Tribes: We Need You to Lead Us

Quote: Only those who play win. Only those who risk win. History favors risk-takers. Forgets the timid. Everything else is commentary.
Author: Iveta Cherneva

Quote: Leaders lead when they take positions, when they connect with their tribes, and when they help the tribe connect to itself.
Author: Seth Godin, Tribes: We Need You to Lead Us

Quote: Victim fall in love with excuses
Author: Robin S. Sharma, The Leader Who Had No Title: A Modern Fable on Real Success in Business and in Life

Quote: Abraham Lincoln was asked by an aide about the church service he had attended. Lincoln responded that the minister was inspired, interesting, well-prepared, eloquent and the topic relevant. The aide said, “Then it was a good service?”Lincoln responded, “No.” The aide protested,“But, Mr. President, you said that the minister was inspired, interesting, well-prepared, eloquent, and that the topic was relevant.”“Yes,” replied Lincoln, “but he didn’t challenge us to do any great thing.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: The essence of community, its heart and soul, is the non-monetary exchange of value; things we do and share because we care for others, and for the good of the place.
Author: Dee Hock, One from Many: VISA and the Rise of Chaordic Organization

Quote: To have reservations is to show true leadership. To have certainty without question, to lead people to battle with no qualms, or to prosecute without hesitation are qualities of a tyrant.
Author: Laura Kreitzer, Abyss

Quote: No less a bold and pugnacious figure than Winston Churchill broke down and was unable to finish his remarks at the sendoff of the British Expeditionary Force into the maelstrom of World War I in Europe.
Author: Barbara W. Tuchman, The Guns of August

Quote: Humiliation is the only ladder to honoring God's Kingdom.
Author: Andrew Murray, Humility

Quote: Any man who has ever led an army, an expedition, or a group of Boy Scouts has sadism in his bones.
Author: Tahir Shah, House of the Tiger King: The Quest for a Lost City

Quote: Good ideas are not adopted automatically. They must be driven into practice with courageous patience.
Author: Hymann Rickover

Quote: Men of God are not just born, they are formed
Author: John Paul Warren

Quote: One mark of a good officer, he remembered, was the ability to make quick decisions. If they happen to be right, so much the better
Author: Larry Niven

Quote: The essence of leadership is not giving things or even providing visions. It is offering oneself and one's spirit.
Author: Lee G. Bolman

Quote: Asking questions will get you the performance you are after far more than dictating demands.
Author: Dan James

Quote: His special gift was the ability to see the essence of a worthwhile suggestion and to relate it to what was already in existence or planned. Then he would encourage and shape the new project, repeatedly redesigning the curriculum so that a new department or course could have a comfortable place in which to grow and offer it benefits.
Author: Charles Bracelen Flood, Lee The Last Years

Quote: I believe it is the duty of each of us to act as if the fate of the world depended on him. Admittedly, one man by himself cannot do the job. However, one man can make a difference. We must live for the future of the human race, and not for our own comfort or success.
Author: Hyman G. Rickover

Quote: One of the fundamental aspects of leadership, I realized more and more, is the ability to instill confidence in others when you yourself are feeling insecure
Author: Howard Schultz, Pour Your Heart Into It: How Starbucks Built a Company One Cup at a Time

Quote: A leader should demonstrate his thoughts and opinions through his actions, not through his words.
Author: Jack Weatherford, Genghis Khan and the Making of the Modern World

Quote: As I have earlier noted, the most important things in life and in business can’t be measured. The trite bromide 'If you can measure it, you can manage it' has been a hindrance in the building a great real-world organization, just as it has been a hindrance in evaluating the real-world economy. It is character, not numbers, that make the world go ‘round. How can we possibly measure the qualities of human existence that give our lives and careers meaning? How about grace, kindness, and integrity? What value do we put on passion, devotion, and trust? How much do cheerfulness, the lilt of a human voice, and a touch of pride add to our lives? Tell me, please, if you can, how to value friendship, cooperation, dedication, and spirit. Categorically, the firm that ignores the intangible qualities that the human beings who are our colleagues bring to their careers will never build a great workforce or a great organization.
Author: John C. Bogle, Enough: True Measures of Money, Business, and Life

Quote: To be an enduring, great company, you have to build a mechanism for preventing or solving problems that will long outlast any one individual leader.
Author: Howard Schultz, Pour Your Heart Into It: How Starbucks Built a Company One Cup at a Time

Quote: To function efficiently, any group of people or employees must have faith in their leader."- Capt. Bligh(ret.)
Author: Robert Lynn Asprin, Another Fine Myth

Quote: A critical element in nearly all effective social movements is leadership. For it is through smart, persistent, and authoritative leaders that a movement generates the appropriate concepts and language that captures the frustration, anger, or fear of the group's members and places responsibility where it is warranted.
Author: David E. Wilkins, The Hank Adams Reader: An Exemplary Native Activist and the Unleashing of Indigenous Sovereignty

Quote: His (Lenin's)humanitarianism was a very abstract passion. It embraced humanity in general but he seems to have had little love for, or even interest in, humanity in particular. He saw the people with whom he dealt, his comrades, not as individuals but as receptacles for his ideas. On that basis, and no other, they were judged. He judged man not by their moral qualities but by their views, or rather the degree to which they accepted his.
Author: Paul Johnson, Modern Times

Quote: All that technical expertise isn't worth a damn if you don't get the best out of people, though. . . . These were leaders who saw strength in ordinary people and showed them how to break tyranny.
Author: Noël Coward

Quote: Some are born leaders, some achieve leadership, and some have leadership thrust upon them. Which of these are you, or would you rather not bother?
Author: Maurice Flanagan

Quote: Finally, the president added, 'The American people are idealists, but they also want their leaders to be realistic...
Author: Bob Woodward, Obama's Wars

Quote: Bailey might not have great intelligence or abilities, but his whole aim, thought and study was that of the born leader--to look out for himself; and he did it with that born-leader's confidence and intensity that draws along the ordinary uncertain man, who soon confuses his own interest and his own safety with that of the leader.
Author: James Gould Cozzens, The Just and the Unjust

Quote: We shall all respect the principle of each other and do nothing that would be regarded as an act oppression to any portion of the people
Author: Alexander Mackenzie

Quote: Be your self at your personal best
Author: John Paul Warren

Quote: It was not only that he was a great man, but, oh, there was such fun in being led by him.
Author: Edward J. Renehan Jr., The Lion's Pride: Theodore Roosevelt and His Family in Peace and War

Quote: Your mission statement, vision statement, core values, and service standards provide a clear focus for all while keeping your team humble and hungry. It creates that family environment in which your employees enjoy coming to work and dealing with the challenges they face each day.
Author: Amber Hurdle, The Bombshell Business Woman: How to Become a Bold, Brave, and Successful Female Entrepreneur

Quote: If your culture is how you do business internally, your brand is what people believe about you externally.
Author: Amber Hurdle, The Bombshell Business Woman: How to Become a Bold, Brave, and Successful Female Entrepreneur

Quote: You can’t be “it” for everyone. In fact, if you try to please everyone, you will please no one, especially yourself.
Author: Amber Hurdle, The Bombshell Business Woman: How to Become a Bold, Brave, and Successful Female Entrepreneur

Quote: You’ve got to get your team to not only understand your company brand, but also to understand their personal brand.
Author: Amber Hurdle, The Bombshell Business Woman: How to Become a Bold, Brave, and Successful Female Entrepreneur

Quote: Even if you delegate that responsibility, ultimately you are the one responsible for howyour brand is portrayed.
Author: Amber Hurdle, The Bombshell Business Woman: How to Become a Bold, Brave, and Successful Female Entrepreneur

Quote: Never take lightly that becoming an employer puts another person’s ability to provide for their life in your hands.
Author: Amber Hurdle, The Bombshell Business Woman: How to Become a Bold, Brave, and Successful Female Entrepreneur

Quote: Train your new employee properly. Sounds so obvious, and yet it often doesn’t happen.
Author: Amber Hurdle, The Bombshell Business Woman: How to Become a Bold, Brave, and Successful Female Entrepreneur

Quote: Treat your employees like you would want to be treated if you were an employee.
Author: Amber Hurdle, The Bombshell Business Woman: How to Become a Bold, Brave, and Successful Female Entrepreneur

Quote: Comprehension is the ability to follow an explanation.Understanding is the ability to be able to lead if needed.
Author: Cody Edward Lee Miller

Quote: A leader is someone who figures out the way, then gets out of the way so others can lead.
Author: Toni Sorenson

Quote: It is better to be a Number Two in a working system, than be a Number One yet lack capacity to make the system work.
Author: Dele Ayo Bankole

Quote: How to uplift others. It’s not a pie, it’s a cake. It’s not a ladder, it’s a bridge.
Author: Richie Norton

Quote: LEADERSHIP is your org chart turned upside down.
Author: Richie Norton

Quote: The magnificence of light can only be seen when it strikes an obstacle. Likewise, the magnificence of a leader is in how he deals with problems.
Author: Charbel Tadros

Quote: If the only way for you to get people to do your bidding is through force or intimidation, you are neither a leader nor a boss: you are an a**hole.
Author: Charbel Tadros

Quote: Yes, You Can!You Can Turn Your... ...Adversity into Your Advantage...Mess into Your Message...Test into Your Testimony...Pain into Your Possibilities ...Setback into a Major Comeback...Gift into Greatness ...Passion into Profit...Success into Significance ...Limitation into Creativity Most importantly, you can and will turn your dreams into reality!
Author: Farshad Asl

Quote: If there isn't a struggle, there's no stretch, and therefore no growth. Easy doesn’t change you and comfort won’t challenge you. Coasting isn't a strategy.
Author: Farshad Asl

Quote: Leadership comes at a cost.It’s called servant leadership.
Author: Farshad Asl

Quote: But oh, the perils of leadership in a species so anxious to be told what to do. How little they knew of what they created by their demands. Leaders made mistakes. And those mistakes, amplified by the numbers who followed without questioning, moved inevitably toward great disasters.
Author: Frank Herbert, Chapterhouse: Dune

Quote: Customer service has everything to do with consistency, systems, training, and the habits you and your team create.
Author: Amber Hurdle, The Bombshell Business Woman: How to Become a Bold, Brave, and Successful Female Entrepreneur

Quote: Everything you attract into your life is a reflection of the story you believe and keep telling yourself.
Author: Farshad Asl

Quote: Love for others is the foundation of leadership.Simplicity is the language of leadership.Authenticity is the true character of leadership.
Author: Farshad Asl, The No Excuses Mindset: MasterMind Edition

Quote: Ideal humane leadership begins with a real demonstration of love, continues relating with acceptance of fellow humankind and consciously follows that through with every opportunity.
Author: Tracey Bond

Quote: Do something in your life which will make millions of people attend your funeral. Have a worthy life.
Author: Mayur Ramgir

Quote: Following trends on social media will not lead to social consciousness.
Author: Carlos Wallace

Quote: Neither mislead nor misguide.
Author: Lailah Gifty Akita

Quote: Leadership is the art of influencing people to execute your strategic thinking
Author: Nabil Basma

Quote: Leadership and learning are indispensable to each other.
Author: John F. Kennedy

Quote: Your company culture is made up of the family rules ofyour business that establish consistent expectations among all.
Author: Amber Hurdle, The Bombshell Business Woman: How to Become a Bold, Brave, and Successful Female Entrepreneur

Quote: When you create a company culture, you are drawing your lines in the sand for you, first & then for anyone else who does business with you.
Author: Amber Hurdle, The Bombshell Business Woman: How to Become a Bold, Brave, and Successful Female Entrepreneur

Quote: All businesses begin and end with their company culture.
Author: Amber Hurdle, The Bombshell Business Woman: How to Become a Bold, Brave, and Successful Female Entrepreneur

Quote: You want how you do business to be consistent among all team members, including partners, management, employees, and even vendors.
Author: Amber Hurdle, The Bombshell Business Woman: How to Become a Bold, Brave, and Successful Female Entrepreneur

Quote: Your company culture is the internal foundation on which everything in your business builds.
Author: Amber Hurdle, The Bombshell Business Woman: How to Become a Bold, Brave, and Successful Female Entrepreneur

Quote: To gain your share of the market, you must show how your company is different and how your culture produces a unique experience for your customers, leaving no room for competition. And that, Bombshell, is your brand.
Author: Amber Hurdle, The Bombshell Business Woman: How to Become a Bold, Brave, and Successful Female Entrepreneur

Quote: When you have a strong company culture it will shine through your brand and you can authentically say, “This is what our brand is about.
Author: Amber Hurdle, The Bombshell Business Woman: How to Become a Bold, Brave, and Successful Female Entrepreneur

Quote: Creating a company culture is the first operational step in becoming a bold, brave fempreneur. It creates certainty, a road map and stability.
Author: Amber Hurdle, The Bombshell Business Woman: How to Become a Bold, Brave, and Successful Female Entrepreneur

Quote: Your mission statement outlines why your company exists. It doesn’t have to be all fancy-pants, just a clear statement of what you do.
Author: Amber Hurdle, The Bombshell Business Woman: How to Become a Bold, Brave, and Successful Female Entrepreneur

Quote: While a mission statement speaks to why a company exists, a vision statement communicates what you want to accomplishin the future.
Author: Amber Hurdle, The Bombshell Business Woman: How to Become a Bold, Brave, and Successful Female Entrepreneur

Quote: Values are the measuring stick for howyou make decisions in business: goal setting, employee conduct, recognition, discipline—everything.
Author: Amber Hurdle, The Bombshell Business Woman: How to Become a Bold, Brave, and Successful Female Entrepreneur

Quote: The ability to kill someone doesn't make you a leader, and it doesn't make someone great. There's nothing great about dying or taking a life.
Author: Adam Burch, Song of Edmon

Quote: Empowerment includes growth mindset, positive thinking, acceptance of new challenge, learning and positive self-image.
Author: Amit Ray, Mindfulness Meditation for Corporate Leadership and Management

Quote: As you get connection with the higher source, your creativity increases
Author: Amit Ray, Mindfulness Meditation for Corporate Leadership and Management

Quote: Mindfulness improves your capacity for self-discovery and empowerment.
Author: Amit Ray, Mindfulness Meditation for Corporate Leadership and Management

Quote: Create gaps between stimulus and reaction and the gap will show you the path.
Author: Amit Ray, Mindfulness Meditation for Corporate Leadership and Management

Quote: When you can, show them, when they can't teach them and when you do remember the only deed worth doing is the one that helps another up.
Author: Bluenscottish

Quote: Part of knowing how to be prepared comes from being self-aware—being able to anticipate what you’ll need (or screw up) and planning accordingly. I know I am rarely, if ever, the smartest person in the room. And that’s totally OK. What’s not OK is (1) not recognizing that and (2) not coming ready to participate in a meaningful way.
Author: Alyssa Mastromonaco, Who Thought This Was a Good Idea?: And Other Questions You Should Have Answers to When You Work in the White House

Quote: Letter to the tech giants:When fame and abundance kiss somebody’s feet before that person is wise enough, he or she is very likely to lose track of what’s necessity and what’s luxury. And modern society is filled with examples of such intelligent stupidity – stupidity that is carried out by apparently smart humans. Because being smart is not the same as being wise. The world has enough smartness, but not enough wisdom to bring that smartness into proper productive practice – and I mean productive practice not sophisticated practice – there is a difference. A person smart enough to visualize a Falcon rocket engine can easily pinpoint the locations of various organizations that spread terrorism, yet the person chooses to explore the space further instead of prioritizing the technological advantages to first fix real issues of the human society that inflict harm to the humans every walk of the way.The world is a miserable place not because we have lack of resources, but because those who have an abundance of resources do not have the slightest idea of true human need. The resources needed for colonizing Mars if put to proper practice can fix the world’s global warming issues – it can fix the world’s climate change issues – it can fix the world’s terrorism issues, yet people are more interested in the pompous idea of living in Mars for whatever reason, instead of paying attention to improving human condition on earth. I am not against technological advancement, for I am a scientist, but my soul aches when I see smart people are dumb enough to chase after illusory glory of doing something different and innovative instead of focusing the powers of their soul on cleaning up the misery business on earth. You can, yet you don’t. Why?Smartness without wisdom is stupidity. You are smart – yes indeed – but I am sorry – you are stupid at the same time. How can you dream of having a cheese burger on Mars when your own kind on Earth is suffering! How can you think of taking rich kids into the orbit just so they can admire the beauty of earth from the heavens, when that very earth is infested with the primordial evils of human character! Awaken the human within you my friend, and pay attention. Awaken the human within and let it consume all the miseries from the world that you live in. Say a member of your family falls ill, would you ignore his or her misery completely just because you want to make life more comfortable for others than it already is, or would you first try everything in your capacity in order to heal your loved one!Be wise my friend, for it is not enough to be smart. You are smart – there is no doubt about that – so utilize that smartness for humanity and heal your own kind. Heal your kind with your capacity my friend. It is wailing for healers – not some delusional faith healers, but real tangible healers. Would you not do anything! Would you not give your soul to fix the broken soul of this world! Arise my friend, Awake my friend and work for humanity, not to make it sophisticated, but to make it peaceful first. Remember, humanity first, then everything else. Peace first, sophistication later. Harmony first, luxury later.
Author: Abhijit Naskar

Quote: Peace first, sophistication later. Harmony first, luxury later.
Author: Abhijit Naskar

Quote: Arise my friend, Awake my friend and work for humanity, not to make it sophisticated, but to make it peaceful first.
Author: Abhijit Naskar

Quote: I have learned a lot about myself over the years, mostly because I was open to hearing feedback. I wear my emotions on my sleeve. I usually dislike someone before I like them. I’m sensitive—especially when I’m tired or feel I’m being misunderstood. This may sound like the “About Me” section on a bad online dating profile, but knowing this stuff has allowed me to keep my contacts, my reputation, and my sanity throughout a long and often stressful career. Being self-aware means knowing when you’re about to act bad—and then not acting bad.
Author: Alyssa Mastromonaco, Who Thought This Was a Good Idea?: And Other Questions You Should Have Answers to When You Work in the White House

Quote: What you realize is that everyone has her own priorities—her own constituency. Often, being a leader is not about making grand proclamations or telling people what to do; it’s about balancing all these priorities and constituencies.
Author: Alyssa Mastromonaco, Who Thought This Was a Good Idea?: And Other Questions You Should Have Answers to When You Work in the White House

Quote: You should always be prepared to defend your choices, whether just to yourself (sometimes this is the hardest) or to your coworkers, your friends, or your family. The quickest way for people to lose confidence in your ability to ever make a decision is for you to pass the buck, shrug your shoulders, or otherwise wuss out. Learning how to become a decision maker, and how you ultimately justify your choices, can define who you are.
Author: Alyssa Mastromonaco, Who Thought This Was a Good Idea?: And Other Questions You Should Have Answers to When You Work in the White House

Quote: Why seek help when you can become the help! Why wish for miracle when you can become the miracle! You are a God O brave-heart – never forget that. Have faith – not in an imaginary monkey up there – but in the powers vested in you by Mother Nature.
Author: Abhijit Naskar, 7 Billion Gods: Humans Above All

Quote: I never understood what it meant to be a Democrat or Republican. I'm fully American and agree on some issues presented by both - but not all of them. So why do I have to pick a side? Nobody can say they agree with every single issue proposed by any team unless they lack the ability to think for themselves. To me, both parties are the same. A method to distract and divide a nation from using common sense and logic. I would want a leader to represent every fraction of the country as one united SUM. To make the country stronger, not weaker. One thing I know for certain, is to never choose a leader who needs their speeches written for them. If they cannot communicate to the public directly with their own heart, then they are not a true leader.
Author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem

Quote: A good leader lays seeds to grow trees of peace. A bad leader lays down bricks to build walls of ignorance. Always choose the peacemaker, not the divider. The one who unites and strengthens a country, not divides and cripples it. A leader that will build bridges, not walls.
Author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem

Quote: Lately, however, I have changed my thinking on this. I have a new Greek mythological figure in mind for the CIO; Cassandra. Cassandra made the critical relationship-building error of spitting on Apollo. As retaliation, Apollo gave Cassandra the power of prophecy, but also the curse of never being believed. (Cassandra eventually goes insane, by the way, so you all have that to look forward to.)
Author: Martha Heller, Be the Business: CIOs in the New Eras of IT

Quote: Great leaders never sought followers but follower seek them
Author: Ikechukwu Joseph, The Complete Leader

Quote: A hero takes steps with the vision of bringing what is beyond the eyes of mere men into reality for them to come to a certain realization. A hero opens doors for the eyes of mere men to see things inside the closed doors and ponder, learn lessons and think of different actions! A hero faces challenges in an overcoming manner with a certain charisma that surpasses the understanding of mere men! To be a hero, one needs a certain gut! It is not as if heroes don’t hit the rock bottom, never! Heroes meet big problems, but big problems and challenges are what defines heroism, and even if heroes are unable to arrest and cripple all the challenges they meet, they must never be discredited for their awesome ingenuity that brought awe, became a yardstick, natured minds, provoked thoughts and caused the envy of mere men to shake, gave people reasons to reason, showed people the essence of life, cleared the path for people to take their journey, and epitomized true heroism! Heroes die after they have blazed the trail! Heroes retire after they have done something unique and unthinkable! Heroes are heroes, regardless of their slips or the big or small things they could never do as heroes, for most times heroes die as heroes whilst challenging the unthinkable challenges! Even if all people don’t see and acknowledge the heroism of a hero, heroes see, feel and understand what it really takes to be a hero! A hero is a hero! Don’t ever undermine heroism!
Author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah

Quote: Let them ask who you are but do not let others dictate who you should be.
Author: Hockson Floin

Quote: Go the extra mile to do the undone, but work within your limits, and in doing so also, don’t be a coward to question things within your limit that are not all that right, and don’t be too arrogant or proud or be filled with excessive knowledge to do things which might though be within your limit, yet out of limit, for you must live and leave nothing, but distinctive and lasting footprints!
Author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah

Quote: The everyday actions of average citizens have a greater impact on society than any politician. Unfortunately politicians exert a disproportionate amount of influence on the actions of the average citizen. If we all use our own ability to positively influence the people around us, time will erode the negative impact of any politician.
Author: Tom Golway

Quote: The nature of your work does not have to be the culture of your team.
Author: Janna Cachola

Quote: The best leaders don't give a damn about the definition of leadership, they are thinking about more important things.
Author: R.A.Delmonico

Quote: Statesmen should remember that they have been elected to persuade and to lead, and not just to accept as fixed the momentary moods and pernicious prejudices of the public.
