Author: Stanley Hoffmann, World Disorders: Troubled Peace in the Post-Cold War Era

Quote: Pass the parcel. That's sometimes all you can do. Take it, feel it, and pass it on. Not for me, not for you, but for someone, somewhere, one day. Pass it on, boys. That's the game I want you to learn. Pass it on.
Author: Alan Bennett, The History Boys

Quote: Money Can make things better but a perfect relationship makes your life complete.
Author: Hockson Floin

Quote: A world without heroes is just an empty world! A world without heroes is just a world without great stories! There are heroes, and there are heroes! A hero takes steps with the vision of bringing what is beyond the eyes of mere men into reality for them to come to a certain realization. A hero opens doors for the eyes of mere men to see things inside the closed doors and ponder, learn lessons and think of different actions! A hero faces challenges in an overcoming manner with a certain charisma that surpasses the understanding of mere men! To be a hero, one needs a certain gut! It is not as if heroes don’t hit the rock bottom, never! Heroes meet big problems, but big problems and challenges are what define heroism, and even if heroes are unable to arrest and cripple all the challenges they meet, they must never be discredited for their awesome ingenuity that brought awe, became a yardstick, natured minds, provoked thoughts and caused the envy of mere men to shake, gave people reasons to reason, showed people the essence of life, cleared the path for people to take their journey, and epitomized true heroism! Heroes die after they have blazed the trail! Heroes retire after they have done something unique and unthinkable! Heroes are heroes, regardless of their slips or the big or small things they could never do as heroes, for most times heroes die as heroes whilst challenging the unthinkable challenges! Even if all people don’t see and acknowledge the heroism of a hero, heroes see, feel and understand what it really takes to be a hero! A hero is a hero! Don’t ever undermine heroism!
Author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah

Quote: The Shoes Should fit! you can't build a business that is not yours.
Author: Hockson Floin

Quote: Leadership including directorship is crucial to strengthen the business links and weave them to the differentiated business capabilities.
Author: Pearl Zhu, Digital Boardroom: 100 Q&as

Quote: The boards as top leadership team can no longer avoid, delegate, or ignore the need for technical competency among their ranks.
Author: Pearl Zhu, Digital Boardroom: 100 Q&as

Quote: Digital leaders including board directors today need to understand that the linear management skills are not sufficient to lead today’s nonlinear digital world with the deep learning curve.
Author: Pearl Zhu, Digital Boardroom: 100 Q&as

Quote: Every authentic leader needs to mind certain gaps and bridge the cognitive difference.
Author: Pearl Zhu, Digital Boardroom: 100 Q&as

Quote: When you get the opportunity to lead, remember it is a noble opportunity not just to amass followers, but to nurture true and great leaders who can do even great things than you!
Author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah

Quote: Be a leader and be a transformer !When you get the opportunity to lead, remember it is a noble opportunity not just to amass followers, but to nurture true and great leaders who can do even greater things than you did! That never wipes off your footprints!
Author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah

Quote: ...you cannot be a leader if no one is willing to follow and work alongside you. An arrogant person does not ask for help and is therefore helpless. An arrogant person claims to know everything and thus is clueless. A humble person attracts helpers and teachers.
Author: Nick Vujicic, Unstoppable: The Incredible Power of Faith in Action

Quote: Be discerning with rumors on leaders, for most are birthed by the envy of the idle or the desperation of the defeated.
Author: Orrin Woodward

Quote: True leaders apply law and grace, for those who only apply only law have little influence and those who apply only grace do not influence properly.
Author: Orrin Woodward

Quote: What is a community? It is the sum total of our choices.
Author: Fredrik Backman, Beartown

Quote: To lead by force all you need is a greater army, but to lead by example, to be a city on a hill, you need an uncompromising respect for basic dignity. And you don't gain either of those things by breeding monsters in dungeons.
Author: Jonathan Maas, City of Gods II: Horsemen

Quote: No matter how much you water the ground, if the ground holds no seed then no plant is coming out. Don’t expect the plant to come out unless you have sown a seed
Author: Lazarus Takawira, The Public Servant

Quote: In a Consciously Constructive Revolutionary Workplace, the focus is on stakeholders, People, Planet AND profits, not just the shareholder's greed of more profits.
Author: Tony Dovale

Quote: Be Gods and make Gods.
Author: Abhijit Naskar, I Am The Thread: My Mission

Quote: Love is the fertile ground that allows obedience to sprout & flourish
Author: Lazarus Takawira, The Public Servant

Quote: Wisdom is the ability to ignore foolishness
Author: Lazarus Takawira, The Public Servant

Quote: PRUNING can be PAINFUL yet it brings PROSPERITY
Author: Lazarus Takawira, The Public Servant

Quote: Selfish leadership is okay with the failure of the successor so as to ensure that any form of praise will continue to be heaped on them
Author: Lazarus Takawira, The Public Servant

Quote: In a Consciously Constructive Revolutionary Workplace, Happiness fuelsHigher Performance, which creates Greater Happiness, which again fuels higher performance.
Author: Tony Dovale

Quote: We are not just the leaders of tomorrow. Leadership is not a destination, leadership is a lifetime journey
Author: Lazarus Takawira

Quote: I am not a man of words, not yesterday, not the day before, not from the first time You spoke to your servant. I am slow of speech and tongue.
Author: Anonymous, Tanakh: The Holy Scriptures

Quote: Be the ocean let the river come to you.
Author: Amit Ray, Enlightenment Step by Step

Quote: Grasp the simplicity and power of no excuses and you have guaranteed success.
Author: Brace E. Barber, No Excuse Leadership: Lessons from the U.S. Army's Elite Rangers

Quote: We are constantly evolving as we are interacting with the world. Mindfulness and growth mindset drives our evolution faster and on right tracks.
Author: Amit Ray, Mindfulness Meditation for Corporate Leadership and Management

Quote: The man who has dedicated himself to the success of the protect, the master builder, no longer has any freedom: his conduct is now determined altogether by the constraining force of the end. Logically, therefore, he is bound to require at every moment from his companions whatever will best serve that end, and he demands of them imperiously whatever he thinks is of that nature. This imperiousness, though to immediate view that of the master, springs ultimately from the project itself, for it is the project which is in command. In the eyes of those under him, however, it is the master who hustles them, and they think him inhuman by reason of his disregard of their moods and personalities and his inability to see them other than as servants of the project (like himself).
Author: Bertrand De Jouvenel, Sovereignty

Quote: The law of all modern states takes account of associations, whose members, in theory, pursue the common end with equal zeal. The experience of all associations proves, however, that this is not the case, and that a lively, constant and vigorous awareness of the end is found only in a minority of the associates; an association is really rather like a comet—a large tail of docile followers dragged along by a small dynamic head.
Author: Bertrand De Jouvenel, Sovereignty

Quote: The more routine that systematised activities are, the more nearly they are of the monotonous character seen in the habits of social animals and the less necessary are master builders; the more novel actions are, the more necessary are master builders. Dislike of the leader and the promoter, though linked emotionally to progressivism, is linked logically to total conservatism. Conversely, an authoritarian approach, natural enough in the instigator of new activities, is unjustified in the mere overseer of routines.
Author: Bertrand De Jouvenel, Sovereignty

Quote: Don't follow the crowd until you are sure you want to be where they're going.
Author: Ruthi Postow Birch, How to Build a Piano Bench

Quote: I believe that the best leadership is loud authenticity. That is what the world needs now. We don’t need more plastic, Photoshopped perfection. I don’t want people to look at me and wish they could be me. I want people to be more accepting of their own failures, imperfections, and struggles because they are inspired by how I accept my own.
Author: Vironika Tugaleva

Quote: Explore new avenues and look for ways to have a greater, much more influential impact on the world around you.
Author: Mayur Ramgir, Evolve Like a Butterfly: A Metamorphic Approach to Leadership

Quote: Fate and family put me in charge of this city. I will run it my way.
Author: Budjette Tan, Murder on Balete Drive

Quote: If given a choice between a potentially great hardship and doing nothing, people gravitate toward what was most familiar and comfortable. That was why leadership was needed. To do what was necessary rather than what was easy.
Author: Michael J. Sullivan, Age of Myth

Quote: The worst thing about having power over other people's lives is that you sometimes get things wrong.
Author: Fredrik Backman, Beartown

Quote: Leadership is not about gaining something from your actions. Gain is the outcome and should not be the purpose.
Author: Mayur Ramgir

Quote: There are hundreds of political prisoners right now in America’s jails who were so taken by Malcolm [X’s} spirit that they became warriors and the powers that be understood them as warriors. They knew that a lot of these other middle-class [black] leaders were not warriors; they were professionals; they were careerists. But these warriors had callings, and they have paid an incalculable and immeasurable price in those cells.
Author: Cornel West, Black Prophetic Fire

Quote: Instead of casting aspersions at the process, why don’t you redirect your energy towards something more advantageous, like finally completing the Program!
Author: Brian   Cook, The Thin Blue Line: Perception is Deception

Quote: Simple is clever. Complicated just means you haven’t been clever enough to reduce ‘it’ to its essence.
Author: Phil Dourado, The Little Book of Leadership: a Free eBook from the Leadership Hub

Quote: Try to lead the leaders and first never follows in whatever case may be, avoid following someone just strive for being followed by other people.
Author: Ntambara Sylvestre Owen Berbason

Quote: The sense of community is that feeling of togetherness that brings us comfort. We are all alone in the world, so we strive to form bonds with others to eliminate that sense of feeling alone.
Author: Del Suggs, Truly Leading: Lessons in Leadership

Quote: Keep making a difference out there! Don't let the noise around you distract you from listening to the voice within you.
Author: Farshad Asl

Quote: As you start your day, are you wondering what you will reap, or are you wondering what you will sow?
Author: John C. Maxwell, Intentional Living: Choosing a Life That Matters

Quote: If you're going to lead people, you've got to have somewhere to go.
Author: S.E. Hinton, Rumble Fish

Quote: Being a leader isn't a title, it's a lifestyle and there is no on and off switch.
Author: Tyconis D. Allison Ty

Quote: The laws of physics that deal with inertia also apply to humans, such that situations tend to remain the same over time.
Author: Del Suggs, Truly Leading: Lessons in Leadership

Quote: Most of the people want to be a leader of winners, but I want to be a leader of losers because losers are the people who truly know the value of winning and they also know how to use and respect it.
Author: G.K. Dutta

Quote: You can lead if you can serve. You can serve when you can love. You can love when you are graced. The truth is that God knows love will be needed in volumes, this is why he made his grace abundant. Leaders are lovers. Misleaders are haters!
Author: Israelmore Ayivor

Quote: Most times, the leader’s ornament isn’t the smiles you see on their faces during the time of victory. It is the sweats we don’t see when they were struggling behind the scenes.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Ensure you have done each day’s portion of the heavy responsibilities resting on you. Never delay your success!
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: When you give up because challenges arise, you are just too ignorant about the power of the gifts you carry within you.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Never let hatred give you an escort. It will drag your attention from all fortunes along the way.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: You don’t see someone flying and you begin to bite yourself for not being able to do that. You do what you can.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Everyone appears to be courageous until bad weathers arrive, and then we know the true leaders.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: When dark situations arise, it is opportunity for you to reveal the leader in you. Rise and deal with them.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor

Quote: Love people who hate you and their hatred won’t get grounds to gain roots.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Ballot papers don’t determine who leads; they determine who takes which position. As to whether that person occupying the position will lead or will manipulate, character must come to prove it.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Would people be excited about your departure from the earth or they would wish you should come back again and again if possible?
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: The leader’s commandment is made up of pledges to solve local and global problems, and not to create more problems to add to the existing ones.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: A leader’s cross is the temporal pain they go through and his crown is the permanent gain when at last victory is achieved.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Leaders #1 job is to help their people, teams, leadership, and culture, to be #FutureFit...by supporting People, Planet & Profits, in a Consciously Constructive Revolutionary Workplace... today.
Author: Tony Dovale

Quote: Leadership is detachment: detachment from material goods, detachment from feelings as well as personal detachment. To lead is to get rid of the filters of the mind and the addictions of the heart, is to see through the fog not only the objectives clearly but also the way to pursue them.
Author: K. Von Novack

Quote: Leadership needs continuous learning from experience. Every time you learn something new, you re-wire your brain.
Author: Amit Ray, Mindfulness Meditation for Corporate Leadership and Management

Quote: Compassion needs new approach and new outlook with the way you see the world.
Author: Amit Ray, Walking the Path of Compassion

Quote: Don’t always complain the way isn’t there. If you can’t find the way, create it.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: If you are an aspiring leader and you have not yet gone through any trouble, prepare for one. It is by going through the hard times that you become harder against the storms of life.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Compassion makes you strong, caring and creative. It creates a different attitude, a level of maturity and understanding, where you do something which makes you stand out of crowd.
Author: Amit Ray, Walking the Path of Compassion

Quote: In the path of compassion our patience, resilience and endurance are often challenged. Sometimes we may fail but we have to stand up again because ultimate joy of compassion is immeasurable for us and the whole world.
Author: Amit Ray, Walking the Path of Compassion

Quote: I was taught that the most hardworking nurse is found at the dirtiest part of the clinical ward.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: People who swim very well in troubled waters are respected and celebrated than those who swim excellently in calm waters.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: People who run away from challenges are cowards and no coward deserves a reward.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Don’t complain of terrible circumstances. It has been proven several times that they are the sources of celebrated trophies.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: The strongest storms make the best sailors. The strongest games make the best players. Tougher challenges make the best leaders.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Leadership is about taking people from a good place to a better place where they would not regret to be.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: When the leader grows, the organization grows.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: When the leader goes wayward, the organization goes wayward.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: This is an everyday question and you must take note of it always. When you wake up, it should be among your number one thoughts. What are you doing for others?
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Don’t wait for someone else to do it so you enjoy. You can’t do it yourself. Just try it.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: No one has the right to pee on your dreams!
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Whatever you want is behind the mountain of struggles. Nothing great comes with ease.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Don’t reduce your impacts to match what you earn.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: The active minority in the world is the fraction that makes the world a better place for the passive majority.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: You don’t need a huge number of people with little passions to get a good job done. You rather need few people with huge passion.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Leaders make impacts. If your riches don’t help you to make impacts, you aren’t leading anyone; rather, money is leading you.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: You missed it when you pay more attention to the damaged car in the mechanic shop than the sick human being in the hospital.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Leaders know how to set priorities. They focus on the task that requires the most rapid attention.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Whatever comes to you in a cheap way will vanish in a cheap way. Be patient and earn it the hard way.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Avoid trying to win tough battles on the silver platter. If the struggle is tough the success is sweet.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Develop the muscles for hard work and never be an early quitter.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Leaders face battles. They don’t run away from troubles.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: If you’re going to give up after few attempts, bear it in mind that your struggles are going to be wasted.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Most times, the way isn’t clear, but you want to start anyway. It is in starting with the first step that other steps become clearer.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: When you are silent on the truth, you have given a transport fare for the lie to travel and spread fast.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: A dream without an action is like a fish without gills. It can’t survive.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Until you step in the game and influence the skills, you will never change the score line.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: It is good to exercise patience. But never let your patience be the type that will keep you refrained from acting.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: A leader is a thorn in the flesh of oppressive people. They never feel comfortable when a leader stands up.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Leaders fight hard wars againstinjustice and unfairness. Theybelieve that the truth is a weapon;when triggered, the lie dies.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Hiding the truth is as evil as feedingthe lie grow tough muscles.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Promised yourself never to keep quiet on the truth. Speak it out and let the lie die
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: When liberators hide their liberty tools, injustice prevails. True leaders intervene by dealing with injustice before it passes puberty.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor

Quote: If you are going to hide yourself and you will not stand against the work of the bad people, you have given them an endorsement.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Silence is very dangerous, especially when your words can be the only source of healing at a moment.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: I noticed that volcanoes, earthquakes and floods, though are not good events, they are better than the silence of good people when bad people take the podium. The latter are to an extent uncontrollable, but the former can be stopped.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: A leader is someone who creates better ways of doing things and better ways are new and comfortable ways.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: If you are not going to divorce the status quo, you will give birth to mediocrity.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: A leader’s goal is to improve on upon the past and if your goal is to remain where you are, doing the same things you have done times and times again, you can’t lead.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Never reject the opportunity to take the first step. The first step is the key to obtaining the experience you have longed for.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Leaders don't rise to the pinnacle of success without developing the right set of attitudes and habits: They make every day a masterpiece. They are also humble enough to realize their victories depend upon their people
Author: Mlungisi Simelane

Quote: It is so much easier to honour the leaders who are honourable.
Author: Gift Gugu Mona

Quote: Attitude is the power of leadership. Nothing can stop a person from achieving success who has the right attitude. Our attitude cannot stop our feelings, but they can prevent our feelings from stopping us
Author: Mlungisi Simelane

Quote: Leaders think and talk about the solutions and progress Followers think and talk about the problems and negative criticism
Author: Mlungisi Simelane

Quote: A potential leader who obeys God is in much better position to succeed than one who ignores God's will for his life
Author: Mlungisi Simelane

Quote: Leadership is not about about having power over people - it is about empowering people ans showing them direction
Author: Mlungisi Simelane

Quote: Your potential is not a trial and error experience. God designed and predetermined you to be a success story.
Author: Mlungisi Simelane

Quote: If you pull a plant out of the soil, you dont need to kill it. It will wither on its own. If you take a fish out of the water, you dont need to kill it. It will suffocate and eventually die. Likewise, if a man takes himself out of connection with God, you dont need to impose destruction on him. He will die spiritually, and its only a matter of time before he dies physically. Do not lose your connection this festive season and beyond. Whoever stays attached to the Source will have life
Author: Mlungisi Simelane

Quote: Your success lies in your ability to believe in yourself
Author: Mayur Ramgir, Evolve Like a Butterfly: A Metamorphic Approach to Leadership

Quote: Convince yourself that you can do it, and the rest of the world will automatically be convinced
Author: Mayur Ramgir, Evolve Like a Butterfly: A Metamorphic Approach to Leadership

Quote: Work hard. Work smart. Remain grounded. Serve others and be enthusiastic.
Author: Sravani Saha Nakhro

Quote: Leadership can mean defiance.
Author: Chuck Wendig, Star Wars - Aftermath - Empire's End

Quote: Thought Leadership “The Downing Street Years” Book by Margaret Thatcher“I have a habit of comparing the phraseology of communiques . . . noting a certain similarity of words, a certain similarity of optimism . . . and a certain similarity in the lack of practical results during the ensuring years.”Margaret Thatcher AuthorFormer British Prime Minister#smitanairjain #leadership #womenintech #thoughtleaders #tedxspeaker #technology #tech #success #strategy #startuplife #startupbusiness #startup #mentor #leaders #itmanagement #itleaders #innovation #informationtechnology #influencers #Influencer #hightech #fintechinfluencer #fintech #entrepreneurship #entrepreneurs #economy #economics #development #businessintelligence #business
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: If you want success as a leader in a complex environment read Commanding Excellence and follow it!
Author: General Bryan ''Doug'' Brown, US Army, Retired; former commander of US Special Operations Command (S

Quote: Convincing a team to believe in a vision takes sponsorship, commitment, and strong leadership. Commanding Excellence demonstrates how to create a culture that everyone commits to from the boardroom to the battlefield. A must-read for anyone who works in a goal-oriented environment
Author: Dave Jones, former Sr Vice President for Holiday Inn, created and launched Homewood Suites and Embas

Quote: It's not about WHO is right, it's about WHAT is right.
Author: Tara Dupuis, The Moody Blues: One Family's Journey Through Postpartum Depression

Quote: Alignment, to us, means bringing pieces into the same line - the same direction. The metaphor is that a magnet will make pieces of iron point toward it. Agreement is share intellectual understanding. Tribes are clusters of people, and people are complex and nonrational at times. If a tribe is united only by agreement, as soon as times change, agreement has to be reestablished. If people learn new ideas or see a problem from a new perspective, they no longer agree, so tribes based on agreement often discourage learning, questioning, and independent thought. Tribes based on alignment want to maximize each person's contribution, provided that they stay pointed in the same direction like magnetized iron filings.
Author: Dave Logan, Tribal Leadership: Leveraging Natural Groups to Build a Thriving Organization

Quote: Alignment, to us, means bringing pieces into the same line - the same direction. The metaphor is that a magnet will make pieces of iron point toward it. Agreement is shared intellectual understanding. Tribes are clusters of people, and people are complex and nonrational at times. If a tribe is united only by agreement, as soon as times change, agreement has to be reestablished. If people learn new ideas or see a problem from a new perspective, they no longer agree, so tribes based on agreement often discourage learning, questioning, and independent thought. Tribes based on alignment want to maximize each person's contribution, provided that they stay pointed in the same direction like magnetized iron filings.
Author: Dave Logan, Tribal Leadership: Leveraging Natural Groups to Build a Thriving Organization

Quote: The most risky day in the world will be the day the bird will decide to swim and the fish will decide to fly. Stay glued to what you can do.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: It is not just about what you can do that will make you a leader. It is about how well you can do it.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: The more you concentrate on what you discover that you will be good for you to pursue, the more experienced you will be while doing it.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Coaching is one of the most effective leadership styles that can transform, empower and unlock people's potential. Ask more, advice less, elevate your impact forever.
Author: Farshad Asl

Quote: Leading means running fast enough to keep ahead of your people
Author: S.M. Stirling, The Sunrise Lands

Quote: This fact is that the heaviest and more burdensome load ever is neither the cement bag nor the iron rod. It is hatred.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Harbour no hatred in your heart against anyone. People who do this have placed their influence on the risky line.
Author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Frontpage: Leadership Insights from 21 Martin Luther King Jr. Thoughts

Quote: Innovators are the ones whose dreams are clearer than the reality that tells them they're crazy.
Author: Simon Sinek, Together is Better: A Little Book of Inspiration

Quote: Jackson’s plight raises difficult questions about leadership and morality. His situation illustrates the need to acknowledge that our leaders will occasionally disappoint themselves and us. If we demand that they be perfect, we risk disillusionment when their shortcomings surface. The underlying flaw of our unwritten compact with leaders is the desperate need to believe that they must be pure to be effective. The best leaders concede their flawed humanity even as they aspire to lofty goals.This does not mean that we should not hold leaders accountable for their actions. To his credit, Jackson acknowledged his failure, sought the forgiveness of his family and followers, and provided for his infant daughter. He is willing to practice the same moral accountability he preaches. Because Jackson has so prominently urged young people to take the high road of personal responsibility, some conclude that his actions reveal hypocrisy. But it is not hypocritical to fail to achieve the moral standards that one believes are correct. Hypocrisy comes when leaders conjure moral standards that they refuse to apply to themselves and when they do not accept the same consequences they imagine for others who offend moral standards.
Author: Michael Eric Dyson

Quote: Younger managers learn quickly that, whatever the public protestations to the contrary, bosses generally want pliable and agreeable subordinates, especially during periods of crisis. Clique leaders want dependable, loyal allies. Thos who regularly raise objections to what a boss or a clique leader really desires run the risk of being considered problems themselves and of being labeled "outspoken," or "nonconstructive," or "doomsayers," "naysayers," or "crepehangers.

Quote: The manager comes to see all relationships with others by a strict utilitarian calculus and, insofar as he dares, breaks friendships and alliances accordingly.

Quote: The most feared situation is to end up inadvertently in the wrong place at the wrong time and get blamed. Yet this is exactly what happens in a structure that systematically diffuses responsibility. It is because managers fear blame-time that they diffuse responsibility; however such a diffusion inevitably means that someone, somewhere is going to become a scapegoat when things go wrong.

Author: Tina Schermer Sellers, Sex, God, and the Conservative Church: Erasing Shame from Sexual Intimacy

Quote: When you’re faced with a choice, choose to inspire, choose to empower, choose to stand for those who have lost the will to stand for themselves.
Author: Orly Wahba, Kindness Boomerang: How to Save the World (and Yourself) Through 365 Daily Acts

Quote: Engage the whole community with a common purpose to build an innovative and sustainable enterprise.
Author: Miguel Reynolds Brandao, The Sustainable Organisation - a paradigm for a fairer society: Think about sustainability in an age of technological progress and rising inequality

Quote: A powerful leader, like a conductor, need not say a word for his message to be communicated.
Author: Orly Wahba, Kindness Boomerang: How to Save the World (and Yourself) Through 365 Daily Acts

Quote: So imagine that fans of our products or services no longer simply consume and use them. Now we are creating a new opportunity for them to both participate directly in the development of the products but also benefit from a share of the profits too.
Author: Miguel Reynolds Brandao, The Sustainable Organisation - a paradigm for a fairer society: Think about sustainability in an age of technological progress and rising inequality

Quote: I see entrepreneurship, like many other activities, as a type of mission. A mission by which we can provide better life chances and quality for both our current and future generations.
Author: Miguel Reynolds Brandao, The Sustainable Organisation - a paradigm for a fairer society: Think about sustainability in an age of technological progress and rising inequality

Quote: Good leaders inspire people to have confidence in their leader. Great leaders inspire people to have confidence in themselves.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: No matter how much you water the ground, if the ground holds no seed then no plant is coming out. Don’t expect the plant to come out unless you have sown the seed
Author: Lazarus Takawira, Imagine Africa

Quote: Great leadership is a reflection of honest service
Author: Lazarus Takawira

Quote: Excellence doesn’t come by obeying doctrines. Excellence comes through recognizing the flaws in the prevailing doctrines of the society and throwing them away if necessary in the path of progress.
Author: Abhijit Naskar, The Education Decree

Quote: You send a message by what you say and what you do. If words aren’t supported with consistent actions, they will ring hollow.
Author: Frank Sonnenberg, BookSmart: Hundreds of real-world lessons for success and happiness

Quote: The spotlight does not change a person, it simply reveals what one has mastered in the darkness
Author: Lazarus Takawira

Quote: I am sorry, I was wrong and it’s my fault, these are words only accustomed to humble leadership
Author: Lazarus Takawira

Quote: The first follower is what transforms a lone nut into a leader." - Quoting Derek Sivers
Author: Adam M. Grant, Originals: How Non-Conformists Move the World

Quote: Leadership is the art of accomplishing more than the science of management says is possible.
Author: Colin Powell

Quote: A value-added step in a process is defined by three characteristics. First, the step must be something that the customer is willing to pay for. Second, the step must directly change the form, fit, or function of something to produce a product or service. The final characteristic of a value-added step is that it is so important that it must be done right every time to successfully produce the intended product or service.
Author: Robert E. Hamm Jr., Continuous Improvement; Values, Assumptions, and Beliefs for Successful Implementation: It's All About the Culture

Quote: When you master the basics, and execute them well, there’s no need to worry about the score.
Author: Frank Sonnenberg, Follow Your Conscience: Make a Difference in Your Life & in the Lives of Others

Quote: It is the sensitive people in any organization that become aware of the need to discover the acceptable "middle" ground between "profit only" and "people only" and act accordingly.
Author: Herman L Glaess

Quote: When you feel that others are lacking and failing ....first assess the skill, style, quality, results, mindset, support, professionalism and spirit with which you yourself play the game.
Author: Rasheed Ogunlaru

Quote: Many great leaders understand intuitively that they need to work hard to create a sense of safety in others. In this way, great leaders are often humble leaders, thereby reducing the status threat. Great leaders provide clear expectations and talk a lot about the future, helping to increase certainty. Great leaders let others take charge and make decisions, increasing autonomy. Great leaders often have a strong presence, which comes from working hard to be authentic and real with other people, to create a sense of relatedness. And great leaders keep their promises, taking care to be perceived as fair.
Author: David Rock, Your Brain at Work: Strategies for Overcoming Distraction, Regaining Focus, and Working Smarter All Day Long

Quote: To create oneself as a Leader the foundation of Integrity must be laid, built with character and aspirations of greatness
Author: Bluenscottish

Quote: Think of strength, dream of strength, live of strength.
Author: Abhijit Naskar, Principia Humanitas

Quote: Marketing without sales is dead.
Author: Richie Norton

Quote: Tethered to our smart phones, we are too caught up and distracted to take the time necessary to sort through complexity or to locate submerged purpose . In our urgent rush to get "there," we are going everywhere but being nowhere. Far too busy managing with transactive speed, we rarely step back to lead with transformative significance.
Author: Kevin Cashman, The Pause Principle: Step Back to Lead Forward

Quote: We stand at an immense fork in the raod. One way is the path of generosity, dignity and a respect for other races and customs; the other leads most certainly to greed, suspicion, hatered and the old, bloody course of violence and waste - and now, God help us, to the very destruction of all the struggles and triumphs of the human race on this earth. My old friends and fellow townsmen: which will it be?
Author: Anton Myrer, Once An Eagle

Quote: Great leaders are most often God’s spokesmen.
Author: Jay Bryan Sandifer

Quote: Courageous people know that saying ‘no’ to one idea enables them to say ‘yes’ to another.
Author: Frank Sonnenberg, Follow Your Conscience: Make a Difference in Your Life & in the Lives of Others

Quote: His request to those listening was to start every day knowing that each minute lost is one that they will never get back and use that thought to drive them forward. This is what resonates most with this writer about our beloved Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid, he is a force of positive energy that the world is in dire need of. Therefore, when people ponder about what it is that makes the government of the United Arab Emirates different one can safely reach the conclusion that, Mohammed Bin Rashid is the difference.
Author: Aysha Taryam

Quote: Real leaders focus resources in areas that provide the greatest opportunity rather than making across-the-board decisions.
Author: Frank Sonnenberg, Follow Your Conscience: Make a Difference in Your Life & in the Lives of Others

Quote: Parishes that have learned to develop a culture of continual invitation to leadership, training, and growth in responsibility for their members are predisposed to ongoing health and growth when pastor transitions occur
Author: William E. Simon Jr., Great Catholic Parishes: A Living Mosiac: How Four Essential Practices Make Them Thrive

Quote: A fool can't help but be a fool, but when others follow, he makes a fool of us all.
Author: DaShanne Stokes

Quote: Every posting, message, or email creates an impression, a public persona, from which other people make judgments. We make judgments about others, but how often do we turn that critical analysis on ourselves?
Author: Kent Alan Robinson, UnSend: Email, text, and social media disasters...and how to avoid them

Quote: Character – the inner world of motives and values that shapes our actions – is the ultimate determiner of the nature of our leadership. It empowers our capacities while keeping them in check. It distinguishes those who steward power well from those who abuse power. Character weaves such values as integrity, honesty, and selfless service into the fabric of our lives, organizations, and cultures.
Author: Bill Thrall, The Ascent of a Leader Experience Guide

Quote: Rephrase the words "staff members" into team members. Because the people in our team are far more than employees, or colleagues. We are a unit!
Author: Janna Cachola

Quote: For every opinion, there is an equal and opposite opinion.
Author: Kent Alan Robinson, UnSend: Email, text, and social media disasters...and how to avoid them

Quote: You are always a gardener. What grow - and how it grows - is up to you.
Author: Jones Loflin, Always Growing

Quote: You have the right to remain silent. Anything you say can and will be used against you in a court of law...Do you understand the rights I have just read to you? With these rights in mind, do you wish to speak to me?” Most Americans adults have heard the Miranda rights from countless television and movie crime drams. The first statement of the Miranda rights is a simple but powerful declarative sentence. “You have the right to remain silent.” Not speaking will not be held against you, but the suspect is told that any words spoken “can and will be used against you in a court of law.” U.S. law provides the opportunity for reflection and protection against self-incrimination with the last sentence asking, “Do you wish to speak to me?” Reflect and ask yourself, it is wise to post or send an email containing that information?
Author: Kent Alan Robinson, UnSend: Email, text, and social media disasters...and how to avoid them

Quote: An organization's proprietary, internal information is constrained only by an understanding that stake-holders will keep organizational matters within the organization.
Author: Kent Alan Robinson, UnSend: Email, text, and social media disasters...and how to avoid them

Quote: A damaging email forwarded outside the organization is indicative of problems within the organization.
Author: Kent Alan Robinson

Quote: The written word imparts a gravitas the spoken word lacks. The underlying assumption is that time and thought has been expended on what was written, even if that is not the case.
Author: Kent Alan Robinson, UnSend: Email, text, and social media disasters...and how to avoid them

Quote: A car crash at seventy-five miles an hour results in glass and steel strewn about the roadway. Emergency workers attend to the injured drivers, passengers and bystanders, and remove the wreckage. An electronic communication wreck lacks the visual drama, but imparts damage just as real and just as permanent. A momentary lapse in judgment may prove catastrophic for the writer, their family, coworkers, and stakeholders.
Author: Kent Alan Robinson, UnSend: Email, text, and social media disasters...and how to avoid them

Quote: Emails, texts and social media promise the writer the power to be heard…In a society where relinquishing control is viewed as weakness, power is relinquished through every message sent without forethought to the potential consequences.
Author: Kent Alan Robinson, UnSend: Email, text, and social media disasters...and how to avoid them

Quote: In the Darwinian environment of business, one's most provocative words are naturally selected by competitors to be hurled back at them at the most inopportune moments. Do not arm your adversaries.
Author: Kent Alan Robinson, UnSend: Email, text, and social media disasters...and how to avoid them

Quote: It is better to apologise later than to ask for permission now. It is called self leadership
Author: Janna Cachola

Quote: Neither inherently good nor evil, electronic communication platforms are 100 percent dependent on user input.
Author: Kent Alan Robinson, UnSend: Email, text, and social media disasters...and how to avoid them

Quote: ...as we proceed to higher and higher levels of expertise, and as the stakes get higher and higher, the agonies of excellence reappear in new and frightening ways. A tiny minority gets through to the top, to memorable excellence or profound understanding. The rest of us stop at stages along the way, perhaps for a temporary rest, perhaps for a period of reassessment. But once we stop, we are unlikely to start up again. Security is suddenly far sweeter than enterprise. The sufferings of the ascent, so long endured by insuppressible aspiration, suddenly seem pointless.
Author: Robert Grudin, The Grace of Great Things: Creativity and Innovation

Quote: To be fully in service to something one has experienced as real is the essence of leadership in a nonhierarchical age. A leader is the holder of a story, someone whose experience of its reality is deep enough so that she can hold the belief on behalf of others.
Author: Charles Eisenstein, The More Beautiful World Our Hearts Know Is Possible

Quote: They'll tell you who they think you should be they'll even try to manipulate you into believing it but let me tell you something son, if I listened to who I was supposed to be - this, everything we are and do wouldn't be in existence. Be a leader, find yourself and make a life with it. Those who judge you and try to force the patterns of their beliefs onto you are envious they haven't the strength in themselves to do the same.
Author: Nikki Rowe

Quote: Reputation is what others perceive you as being, and their opinion may be right or wrong. Character, however, is what you really are, and nobody knows that but you.
Author: John Wooden

Quote: You are always a gardener. What grows - and how it grows - is up to you.
Author: Jones Loflin, Always Growing

Quote: One reason I continue to oppose efforts to criminalize abortion is that I do not believe any government should have the power to dictate, through law or police action, a woman's most personal decisions.""I consider that a slippery slope to state control of reproduction, and I'd witnessed the consequences of such control in China and Communist Romania.
Author: Hillary Rodham Clinton, Living History

Quote: I don't need to be vocal about my intentions, I am just intentional about my actions.
Author: Janna Cachola

Quote: Once a message has been sent electronically, the writer has ceded power not just to the recipient, but to whomever the recipient chooses to forward the information. To access electronic communication is to control it. The recipient, not the writer, has power over future dissemination of the writer’s words.
Author: Kent Alan Robinson, UnSend: Email, text, and social media disasters...and how to avoid them

Quote: Clear direction leads to clear results
Author: Paul Bradley Smith

Quote: Generous leaders are servant leaders. They always come with open hands and an open heart.
Author: Farshad Asl, The "No Excuses" Mindset: A Life of Purpose, Passion, and Clarity

Quote: The most attractive thing about you should have less to do with your face or body and more to do with your attitude and how you treat people.
Author: Germany Kent

Quote: You Are At Different Levels With Different People.
Author: Syed Sharukh

Quote: Never embrace a version of the gospel that doesn't require you to do life with someone who isn't like you.
Author: Reggie Joiner

Quote: Leadership isn't just about giving orders. A fool can give orders. A leader listens. He changes his mind. He acknowledges mistakes.
Author: Brian Staveley, The Emperor's Blades

Quote: LOVE is Leadership through Optimism, Value, and Endurance.
Author: Farshad Asl, The "No Excuses" Mindset: A Life of Purpose, Passion, and Clarity

Quote: Leadership is not only about producing results or measuring success with statistics. Leadership is doing something with significance that makes families, organizations, societies, nations, and the world a better place before you die.
Author: Farshad Asl, The "No Excuses" Mindset: A Life of Purpose, Passion, and Clarity

Quote: LEGACY plays an important role in defining a good leader at any age.
Author: Farshad Asl, The "No Excuses" Mindset: A Life of Purpose, Passion, and Clarity

Quote: Mr Mandela, who had given his whole life for justice and had never once thought of himself. How unlike these people were modern politicians, who thought only of power and tricks.
Author: Alexander McCall Smith, The Full Cupboard of Life

Quote: Though sometimes you must have an unstoppable courage, it must be with a well defined humility for purposeful living! Humility is not just good for our lives; it also greatly saves our lives, integrity and true purpose! Don’t just think you are on top of the world just because you stand on the tallest building. When the building collapses, you may be far worse than they that walk besides the building who can run away upon seeing it collapsing!
Author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah

Quote: You are responsible for everything you TWEET and RETWEET.
Author: Germany Kent

Quote: No institution can become the cradle of leadership, until its teachers break their manacles of rugged dogmas.
Author: Abhijit Naskar

Quote: I wrote Beyond The Label to open up the aperture through which we look at the world. I want us to reconsider what it means to be a woman, a mentor, a wife, a mother.
Author: Maureen Chiquet, Beyond the Label: Women, Leadership, and Success on Our Own Terms

Quote: Good leaders are always in the “act” of leading. They listen as much to others as they listen to themselves.
Author: Maureen Chiquet, Beyond the Label: Women, Leadership, and Success on Our Own Terms

Quote: Allowing yourself to follow the crevices of your heart lines is a messy process and not easy to characterize or rationalize into neat and tidy lists and boxes.
Author: Maureen Chiquet, Beyond the Label: Women, Leadership, and Success on Our Own Terms

Quote: This book is for those of you who are tired of trying to squeeze into constrained categories, who long for a life without limits on who you are or who you will become.
Author: Maureen Chiquet, Beyond the Label: Women, Leadership, and Success on Our Own Terms

Quote: The underlying issue in getting women to top positions is what kind of leadership we value and how we teach, assess, and promote “good” leaders in all organizations.
Author: Maureen Chiquet, Beyond the Label: Women, Leadership, and Success on Our Own Terms

Quote: Be bold in pursuing what others believe is unrealistic because this will achieve more than being bland and unimaginative.
Author: Janna Cachola

Quote: When your leadership and legacy are built on love, obstacles are overcome through love’s fruit of optimism, foundations are built solid and secure in love’s values, and success is achieved through the strength found in love’s endurance.
Author: Farshad Asl, The "No Excuses" Mindset: A Life of Purpose, Passion, and Clarity

Quote: The more you've struggled, the more inspiring your story will be when you come out the other side. Do not give up. Today's struggle brings tomorrow's wisdom.
Author: Vironika Tugaleva

Quote: When you accept a leadership role, you take on extra responsibility for your actions toward others. If you shun someone, the effect will trickle down through those who value your opinion.
Author: Kelley Armstrong, The Calling

Quote: The main tenet of design thinking is empathy for the people you're trying to design for. Leadership is exactly the same thing - building empathy for the people that you're entrusted to help.
Author: David Kelley

Quote: Maybe he wasn’t there to lead so much as to provide an illusion to the others that they were being led.
Author: Hugh Howey, Shift

Quote: Leadership is all about leading your life with a cause greater than yourself and continuously doing self-development.
Author: Deepak Burfiwala, Self-Ignorance Is Your Problem. Self-Awareness Is Your Solution.: Success Is Your Birthright! Life Is Yours and You Are the Pilot of It, Do Something about It.

Quote: Fair-minded people earn the respect of their colleagues rather than demanding it.
Author: Frank Sonnenberg, Follow Your Conscience: Make a Difference in Your Life & in the Lives of Others

Quote: Relational congruence is the ability to be fundamentally the same person with the same values in every relationship, in every circumstance and especially amidst crisis. It is the internal capacity to keep promises to God, to self and to one's relationships that consistently express one's identity and values in spiritually and emotionally healthy ways. Relational congruence is about both constancy and care at the same time. It is about both character and affection, and self-knowledge and authentic self-expression. Relational congruence is the leader's ability to cultivate strong, healthy, caring relationships; maintaining healthy boundaries; and communicating clear expectations, all while staying focused on the mission.
Author: Tod Bolsinger, Canoeing the Mountains: Christian Leadership in Uncharted Territory

Quote: Those who criticize the innovative concept of multi-site churches must also remember that at one point stained glass and hymnals were new as well.
Author: Braden Pedersen

Quote: You can’t lead without love, and more importantly, you can’t leave a legacy without love.
Author: Farshad Asl, The "No Excuses" Mindset: A Life of Purpose, Passion, and Clarity

Quote: ...The happy Warrior... 'tis he whose law is reason; who depends upon that law as on the best of friends; whence, in a state where men are tempted still to evil for a guard against worse ill, and what in quality or act is best doth seldom on a right foundation rest, he labors good on good to fix, and owes to virtue every triumph that he knows: who, if he rise to station of command, rises by open means; and there will stand on honorable terms, or else retire, and in himself possess his own desire; who comprehends his trust, and to the same keeps faithful with a singleness of aim; and therefore does not stoop, nor lie in wait for wealth, or honors, or for worldly state; whom they must follow; on whose head must fall, like showers of manna, if they come at all:
Author: William Wordsworth, Character of the Happy Warrior

Quote: Stop grovelling and start working.
Author: Abhijit Naskar

Quote: You are born to build the society, not to follow it.
Author: Abhijit Naskar

Quote: The world needs heroes. Be a hero and build your part of the world.
Author: Abhijit Naskar

Quote: True Leaders take an Ordinary Person and turn them into an Extraordinary Performer.
Author: Farshad Asl

Quote: You don't die when your body stops functioning. You die when your name is uttered for the last time in the world.
Author: Abhijit Naskar

Quote: Throw away the newspapers. Discard all the useless debates and gossiping. Start working in silence. Start working on your passion. And make the news yourself.
Author: Abhijit Naskar

Quote: Have patience and keep working. Everything will come alright in time.
Author: Abhijit Naskar

Quote: Leadership without servanthood is like an ocean without water.
Author: Farshad Asl

Quote: Innovative leaders today are digital conductors, problem-solvers, and culture influencers.
Author: Pearl  Zhu, Unpuzzling Innovation: Mastering Innovation Management in a Structural Way

Quote: Innovative thinkers are explorers and synthesizers of new world views or future views of the world.
Author: Pearl  Zhu, Unpuzzling Innovation: Mastering Innovation Management in a Structural Way

Quote: Diplomacy in leadership is winning the war on behalf of both sides
Author: Lazarus Takawira

Quote: Courageous people know that old ways of doing things shouldn’t stand in the way of a better solution.
Author: Frank Sonnenberg, Follow Your Conscience: Make a Difference in Your Life & in the Lives of Others

Quote: A true revolution is about making those who are comfortable with corruption, uncomfortable. It's about pointing your fingers in the right direction and with nothing but the truth, will come power. A power not to exploit the Liberian people. But an ability to restore liberty, justice, and prosperity for all." - Henry Johnson Jr
Author: Henry Johnson Jr, Liberian Son

Quote: True leaders don't look at just the outward appearances in the selection of team members, they look at one's core values and heart.
Author: Farshad Asl

Quote: ...The happy Warrior... is he... whose powers shed round him in the common strife, or mild concerns of ordinary life, a constant influence, a peculiar grace; but who, if he be called upon to face some awful moment to which Heaven has joined great issues, good or bad for human kind, is happy as a lover; and attired with sudden brightness, like a man inspired; and, through the heat of conflict, keeps the law in calmness made, and sees what he foresaw; or if an unexpected call succeed, come when it will, is equal to the need: he who, though thus endued as with a sense and faculty for storm and turbulence, is yet a soul whose master-bias leans to homefelt pleasures and to gentle scenes; sweet images! which, wheresoe'er he be, are at his heart; and such fidelity it is his darling passion to approve; more brave for this, that he hath much to love:
Author: William Wordsworth, Character of the Happy Warrior

Quote: A level 4 leader's greatest asset is his ability to engage, empower, and equip his people; this is what creates the momentum for a significant change in the organization. He invests 80% in his people and 20% in the process.
Author: Farshad Asl

Quote: A journey to make real impact that changes lives, give meaning to life and living, and turns vision of the masses into realities demands a true focus, an utmost zeal and robustness and an unfailing tenacity to do whatever necessary within the powers and reach of a true leader, and with all needed dexterity, wit and wisdom, to make real impact have a meaning and give real liberation to the masses!
Author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah

Quote: Simplicity is the language of leadership.
Author: Farshad Asl

Quote: Sins of omission should be regarded as far more serious than sins of commission,
Author: Stephen Bungay, The Art of Action: How Leaders Close the Gaps between Plans, Actions and Results

Quote: Telling people what to do is showmanship.Showing people how to do it is leadership.
Author: Janna Cachola

Quote: Legacy is more than leaving possessions behind. It's about investing in people with passion and integrity through leadership and love.
Author: Farshad Asl

Quote: You won this job because you were the best for the job. You are smart, quick to learn, and can quickly acquire any skill you might be lacking.
Author: Carla Harris, Expect to Win: Proven Strategies for Success from a Wall Street Vet

Quote: Mathematics is life: the workings (process) is more important than the answer (proof/product). A wrong process cannot make a right product.
Author: Dele Ayo Bankole

Quote: [On action filled leadership] Telling your team what to do is showmanship.Showing people how to do it is leadership. Leading for the purpose of visual effect will not accomplish the vision.
Author: Janna Cachola

Quote: Leadership does not always wear the harness of compromise.
Author: Woodrow Wilson

Quote: Leadership is influencing others through modeling.
Author: Farshad Asl

Quote: Entrepreneurial Leadership is where your vision, influence and creativity converge; it is where opportunities become limitless and your capabilities boundless.
Author: Farshad Asl, The "No Excuses" Mindset: A Life of Purpose, Passion, and Clarity

Quote: Leadership is the art of intentional living.
Author: Farshad Asl

Quote: True leadership is the orchestration of truth into action to shine Light into darkness.
Author: Orrin Woodward

Quote: I learned that when you can turn a presentation into a conversation, you have won the battle of converting a client; and second, I learned that the real Carla was my best competitive weapon and my key personal advantage.
Author: Carla Harris, Expect to Win: Proven Strategies for Success from a Wall Street Vet

Quote: When I give the best of me, that becomes my legacy.
Author: Karen Lopez McWilliams, The Ones Who Believed: True Inspirational Stories of Everyday People Who Took a Chance, Shaped a Life and

Quote: People who repeatedly find career success learn to broaden their perspective and understand that there are always several roads to getting where you want to go.
Author: Carla Harris, Expect to Win: Proven Strategies for Success from a Wall Street Vet

Quote: Leaders don't assume. Assumptions are the termites of leadership. Communicate, communicate, and communicate, until you connect.
Author: Farshad Asl

Quote: Leadership is the act of serving others and has no gender preference.
Author: Farshad Asl

Quote: Men's Leadership Success Formula: Get up, Show up, Man up, Mentor up, and Move up!
Author: Orrin Woodward

Quote: The accumulation of non-obvious, ineffective, or misapplied actions leads to low productivity.
Author: Chris Behnke

Quote: The problem is not lack of leadership, the problem is lack of good leadership
Author: Lazarus Takawira, Imagine Africa

Quote: DONOVAN: Court’s a good leader. He doesn’t hold my hand or treat anyone like a child. He’s kicked a few *sses when guys went off script to make their own moves. Once he even scared the sh*t out of one of the older guys.
Author: Bijou Hunter, Snake Charmer

Quote: Serving is the best kind of Leading.
Author: Todd Stocker

Quote: Leadership is the capacity to turn vision into reality.
Author: Warren Bennis

Quote: He has the power to render us happy or unhappy, to make our service light or burdensome, a pleasure or a toil. Say that his power lies in words and looks, in things so slight and insignificant that it is impossible to add and count 'em up; what then? The happiness he gives is quite as great as if it cost a fortune.
Author: Charles Dickens, A Christmas Carol and Other Christmas Writings

Quote: The tragedy about history - personally and globally - is that while we may learn it we rarely learn from it.
Author: Rasheed Ogunlaru

Quote: In a world full of lions and tigers entertaining the masses, have you ever seen a wolf performing in a circus?
Author: Akilnathan Logeswaran

Quote: Be yourself! Don’t try to fabricate your personality in the guise of impressing others.
Author: Ashish Patela

Quote: I must rule with eye and claw — as the hawk among lesser birds. - Duke Leto Atreides
Author: Frank Herbert, Dune

Quote: No one can make you successful, the will to succeed comes from within
Author: Fabrizio Moreira, The Gift That Would Change My Life

Quote: Tell them a lie big enough, they'll worship you as a sage. Tell them a truth big enough and they'll mock you.
Author: Abhijit Naskar

Quote: Highly engaged teams have highly engaged leaders. Leaders must be about presence not productivity. Make meetings a no phone zone.
Author: Janna Cachola

Quote: If you have a vision and there is no job title for it yet. That's a vision right there!
Author: Janna Cachola

Quote: Your superpowers don't care who you dislike. If you are an encourager, you encourage them anyway
Author: Janna Cachola

Quote: To use an analogy, the "leadership is the answer to everything" perspective is the modern equivalent of the, 'God is the answer to everything' perspective that held back our scientific understanding of the physical world in the Dark Ages. In the 1500's, people ascribed all events they didn't understand to God. Why did the crops fail? God did it. Why did we have an earthquake? God did it. What holds the planets in place? God. But with the Enlightenment, we began the search for a more scientific understanding - physics, chemistry, biology and so forth. Not that we become atheists, but we gained deeper understanding about how the universe ticks.Similarly, every time we attribute everything to 'Leadership," we're no different from the people in the 1500's. We're simply admitting our ignorance. Not that we should become leadership atheists (leadership does matter), but every time we throw our hands up in frustration - reverting back to "well, the answer must be Leadership!" - we prevent ourselves from gaining deeper, more scientific understanding about what makes great companies tick.
Author: James C. Collins, Good to Great: Why Some Companies Make the Leap... and Others Don't

Quote: A leader without a team, is a car without steering wheel
Author: Fabrizio Moreira, The Gift That Would Change My Life

Quote: I don't buy dreams, i buy actions
Author: Fabrizio Moreira, The Gift That Would Change My Life

Quote: A real job can kill a real dream, chase your real dreams
Author: Fabrizio Moreira, The Gift That Would Change My Life

Quote: A leader cannot fall prey to the whims of the voices that shout the loudest, but must stand as a voice of reason in defense of the silent.
Author: Saminu Kanti

Quote: A humble learner of today becomes a strong leader of tomorrow.
Author: Abhijit Naskar, Love, God & Neurons: Memoir of a Scientist Who Found Himself by Getting Lost

Quote: People of color are allowed, even required to perform, and, especially these days on issues of race, to edify as well. 'Here you are, now entertain us'. But are we allowed to lead?
Author: Jeff Chang, We Gon' Be Alright: Notes on Race and Resegregation

Quote: Don't apologize for expressing passion.Don't back down when it comes to your integrity.Don't let anyone undermine your standards for the sake of ease.Be a character of excellence, NOT excuses.
Author: Janna Cachola

Quote: Without the right succession planning put to play in human resources, we build for the future without a future
Author: Mmanti Umoh

Quote: If your ministry can't work without you, then it is no longer Christ-centered. Minister toward Jesus, not yourself.
Author: Rev. Kellen Roggenbuck

Quote: When quitting is done correctly, it isn't giving up - it's making room for something better.
Author: Adam Kirk Smith

Quote: Titles don’t mean anything. What really matters is the impact you make on a daily basis!
Author: Akilnathan Logeswaran

Quote: I'm not a follower. I'm a leader. And anyone who speaks their mind is always criticised.
Author: Tyler, the Creator

Quote: Entitlement is such a cancer, because it is void of gratitude.
Author: Adam Kirk Smith

Quote: Our best-laid plans are often our worst-made decisions.
Author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

Quote: Ever since I was 12 years old, my mother have always taught me to learn to be a leader. To start learning now! When you have the time to take time to learn and have every chance to be mentored. Don't be ashamed to be high maintenance when it comes to development.
Author: Janna Cachola

Quote: Ideas love speed
Author: Bernard Kelvin Clive

Quote: Neither care too much nor too little about the feedback of others.
Author: Miles Anthony Smith, Why Leadership Sucks™ Volume 2: The Pain, Pitfalls, and Challenges of Servant Leadership Fundamentals

Quote: You should lead and serve by example without a title because people will and should remember you by and for your actions and accomplishments for doing good not by your title or positions.
Author: George Stamatis

Quote: Someday” is a dangerous word.
Author: Miles Anthony Smith, Why Leadership Sucks™ Volume 2: The Pain, Pitfalls, and Challenges of Servant Leadership Fundamentals

Quote: Self-leadership is the most effective way to train leaders. How do you do that? Empower them to make decisions, you as a leader back them up and allow them to follow through
Author: Janna Cachola

Quote: The goal of leadership is not to be likable or loved but to be proven trustworthy and respected.
Author: Miles Anthony Smith, Why Leadership Sucks™ Volume 2: The Pain, Pitfalls, and Challenges of Servant Leadership Fundamentals

Quote: Leaders bring things to conclusion, not necessarily consensus.
Author: Miles Anthony Smith, Why Leadership Sucks™ Volume 2: The Pain, Pitfalls, and Challenges of Servant Leadership Fundamentals

Quote: Pride does not only come with great responsibility. It is buy one get one free. Great responsibility will require great resourcefulness.
Author: Janna Cachola

Quote: I choose not to fight against but to stand for. Not to go against but to go for.
Author: O. Stephen Peart

Quote: Instead of thinking that you always need to do bigger things, learn to do the small things in better ways.
Author: Adam Kirk Smith

Quote: To believe in the possibilities of self is to unleash the power of the spirit quieted by doubt ~
Author: Bluenscottish

Quote: As a leader, your main responsibility is to remove any barriers that stand in the way.
Author: Adam Kirk Smith

Quote: Success is the moment you realize that all you failed at created the masterpiece of your life.~
Author: Bluenscottish

Quote: What separates those who build exceptional lives from others, is the way they use their time.
Author: Paul Oberschneider, Why Sell Tacos in Africa?: 16 life-changing business strategies you can use anywhere, from the man who turned $400 into $200 million

Quote: Professionalism shouldn't be defined by a persons paycheck, role or title. It should be defined by a persons work ethic
Author: Janna Cachola

Quote: Only when we face the impossible, and experience the unbearable, do we find out who we truly are.
Author: Vironika Tugaleva

Quote: There is no greater suffering than constantly measuring yourself and coming up short, except perhaps the realization that your suffering is hurting others. But where do we learn these things? Because, really, they are learned. We don't come crying out of the womb because of our birth weight or because we have no money in this brand new world. We learn to measure and we learn to attach our self-worth to those measurements.These patterns we're stuck in aren't just painful for us, they're also distracting us. Every day, the gap between rich and poor grows while the people of developed societies do nothing, because we are too busy worrying about looking good. We're distracted, but not because we've chosen to be. Being distracted by our illusory inadequacy keeps us from changing the world. And believe me, we all have the power to change the world. If we only make the time. If we only free some head space.If you can't learn to love yourself for yourself (and how could you with such a paradoxical motivation?)... then do it for us. Do it for the world. We need you. We need your mind. We need your attention. We need your thoughts. Change your focus, and you will (not can, but will) change the world. You already matter. You just have to realize it for yourself.
Author: Vironika Tugaleva

Quote: A woman with vision is unstoppable, a woman who is always increasing her skills multiplies. Along with passion this woman is undeniable.
Author: Janna Cachola

Quote: Control what you can. Influence what you should. Forget the rest.
Author: Todd Stocker

Quote: A leader must stand up for his team even when he has to stand alone.
Author: Farshad Asl

Quote: Communication is the real work of leadership.
Author: Nitin Nohria

Quote: Successful leaders leaders lead with passion and compassion.
Author: Farshad Asl

Quote: Go on your way , use you brain , be innovative, achieve your dreams and don’t turn back, because you left so many envious people behind you !! …
Author: Ibnoulkhatib Yahya

Quote: Leaders are called upon to build not to repair.
Author: Farshad Asl

Quote: As we look ahead into the future, leaders will be those who serve others, actively listen, and daily empower.
Author: Farshad Asl

Quote: The ‘No Excuses’ mindset is not only composed of net worth, but also self worth and network.
Author: Farshad Asl, The "No Excuses" Mindset: A Life of Purpose, Passion, and Clarity

Quote: The gravitas in a leader is like clarity in diamond.
Author: Pearl Zhu, Thinkingaire: 100 Game Changing Digital Mindsets to Compete for the Future

Quote: Leadership is a choice. It is not a rank.
Author: Simon Sinek

Quote: We go from most doubted to most respected with the right outlook and attitude to life.
Author: Torron-Lee Dewar, 50 Ways to Become a Better Choreographer

Quote: At least half the job of CEO is communication - because of human nature. People fear what they don't know. If the board wasn't hearing that things were going well, they assumed that things must be going badly.
Author: Biz Stone, Things a Little Bird Told Me: Confessions of the Creative Mind

Quote: While you're worrying about becoming famous, there is someone out there putting in work and not wasting a second of their time. Which person will you be?
Author: Torron-Lee Dewar, 50 Ways to Become a Better Choreographer

Quote: Speaking the unspeakable. As a leader, you need to not just listen to what’s being said, but more importantly, what's not being said.
Author: Pearl Zhu, Thinkingaire: 100 Game Changing Digital Mindsets to Compete for the Future

Quote: Leadership is the day to day communications about the real issues.
Author: Chris Argyris

Quote: Words and actions will separate a wise man from the crowd.
Author: Bamigboye Olurotimi

Quote: People will buy from you consistently for two reasons – because you have cultivated a relationship and because you have gotten them results.
Author: Audrey Moralez

Quote: Our capacity can grow or diminish, and either way, the results compound over time.
Author: Audrey Moralez

Quote: Let there be a child, who should,not be taught. Let there be a child, who should,be refrained from books. Let him not hear, don’t preach him, dear. Don’t let him read the quotations,on internet and make them his passion. Don’t tell him stories of successful,and make them his anthem.Allow him to grow unto what,he is to know.
Author: Jasleen Kaur Gumber

Quote: The lack of truth in one's words and actions is manifested in the failed attempts at success. Without integrity, reinvention has no impact~
Author: Bluenscottish

Quote: If you must walk in someone's shadow make sure it's your own
Author: Rasheed Ogunlaru

Quote: Reform is usually possible only once a sense of crisis takes hold.... In fact, crises are such valuable opportunities that a wise leader often prolongs a sense of emergency on purpose.
Author: Charles Duhigg, The Power of Habit: Why We Do What We Do in Life and Business

Quote: Digital leadership must be extremely visionary, mindful, creative, empathetic, generous, conscious, passionate, and humble.
Author: Pearl Zhu, Digitizing Boardroom: The Multifaceted Aspects of Digital Ready Boards

Quote: Anybody who leads with hate, is not fit for leadership.
Author: Jeanette Coron

Quote: Character in leadership comes down to two questions: Would you trade places with anyone under your command? Do you hold yourself to the same level of accountability as those for whom you bear responsibility?
Author: Gary J. Byrne, Crisis of Character: A White House Secret Service Officer Discloses His Firsthand Experience with Hillary, Bill, and How They Operate

Quote: We have reached a time where we are suppressing talents in our communities with our common thinking.
Author: Auliq Ice

Quote: The queer thing is that we do trust you," said Bodisham. "In spite of your -- extremism.""You'd better," said Rud with grim conviction. "I'm right. What is extremism? The whole truth and nothing but the truth. I ask you.""It's because of his extremism you trust him," said Chiffan. "It's because in the last resort we believe in his indiscretion, and know he won't fail us even if we fail ourselves. All leadership is extravagance. Extra-vagance. Going a bit ahead."Rud did not quite understand that. "It's because you know I'm right," he said."It's because," said Chiffan, letting his thoughts run away with him," to make a new world, the leader must be a fundamentally destructive man, a recklessly destructive man. He breaks his way through the jungle and we follow...We cannot do without you, Rud.
Author: H.G. Wells, The Holy Terror

Quote: People who copy you will always be one step behind.
Author: Wayne Gerard Trotman

Quote: But how do you come ‘offline’ when so much of our daily lives is moving ‘online’? Every month new sites and online services are launched. If you need to check anything – about a new school for your children, medical treatment, tourist destination or recipe – you go online.
